Description: PROJECT TITLE: PRESERVATION OF GEOLOGIC DATA AND COLLECTIONS IN ILLINOISPROJECT PERIOD: 8 1 2023 THROUGH 7 31 2025PRIORITY 1:AWARD PURPOSE: THE AIM OF THIS PRIORITY ONE PROJECT IS TO MOVE THE STRATPAL COLLECTION TO THE NEWLY REFURBISHED PRAIRIE RESEARCH INSTITUTE CENTER FOR PALEONTOLOGY COLLECTIONS FACILITY FOLLOWED BY RE-CURATION AND DIGITIZATION EFFORTS OF THE COLLECTION.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE DRAWERS WILL BE MOVED INTO NEW CABINETRY. SPECIMENS WILL BE MOVED INTO BRAND-NEW CABINETRY AND DIGITIZED WITH A KEYENCE MODEL VHX-7000 MICROSCOPE. ADDITIONALLY, ALL TAXONOMIC, STRATIGRAPHIC, AND LOCALITY DATA, INCLUDING TRANSCRIBED VERBATIM LABEL DATA WILL BE RECORDED IN THE CENTER FOR PALEONTOLOGY TAXONWORKS ONLINE DATABASE AS WELL AS AN UPDATE TO METADATA ON RESCICOLL.DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES  CENTER FOR PALEONTOLOGY TAXONWORKS RECORDS ANDUPDATED METADATA ON RESCICOLL.INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES)  RESEARCHERS WORKING IN ILLINOIS AND SURROUNDING STATES (PARTICULARLY INDIANA, KENTUCKY, MISSOURI, WISCONSIN, AND IOWA) ON UPPER PLEISTOCENE QUATERNARY GEOLOGY.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE.PRIORITY 2:AWARD PURPOSE: PRESERVATION OF THE TUNNEL AND RECLAMATION PROJECT (TARP) CORE DRILLED IN THE CHICAGO METRO AREA.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE ROOM WILL BE OUTFITTED WITH ROLLING BENCHES TO MAKE A RECONFIGURABLE WORK AREA FOR TARP PROCESSING. EXISTING SINKS UPDATED WITH SEDIMENT TRAPS TO PREVENT DAMAGE FROM SEDIMENT DURING MATERIAL PROCESSING ACTIVITIES (WASHING TARP CORE). LED LIGHTING WILL BE ADDED TO THE WORKSPACES. CONTINUED WORK ON NGGDPP FY22 TARP CORE ANALYSES (PROCESSING, PHOTOGRAPHY, PXRF ANALYSIS, RE-CURATION, ETC.) WILL BE COMPLETED, AND METADATA ENTERED.DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES  CURATED TARP CORE, TARP CORE DATA ADDED TO THE ISGS BOREHOLE DATABASE, AND METADATA CREATED FOR CORE.INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES): INDUSTRY, RESEARCHERS, AND THE PUBLIC WORKING IN THE CHICAGO METRO AREA.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONEPRIORITY 3:AWARD PURPOSE: RESURRECTION OF THE WHITE COUNTY CORE AS THE STANDARD REFERENCE SECTION FOR THE ILLINOIS BASIN THROUGH REUNITING ITS SCATTERED COMPONENTS INTO A SINGLE COLLECTION.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED  WORK ON THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE PHOTOGRAPHY OF CORE BISCUITS AND CRUSHED CORE SAMPLES. PLACEMENT IN NEW, LABELED ARCHIVE QUALITY CLEAR BAGS AND BOXES. SCANS OF ORIENTED POLISHED SLABS AND PHOTOGRAPHY OF ORIENTED MACROFOSSIL WHITE CORE SAMPLES WILL OCCUR. THE CORE WILL BE ANALYZED USING PORTABLE X-RAY FLUORESCENCE, WIKI PAGE DESCRIBING WHITE COUNTY CORE FOR ILSTRA T INCLUDING A DETAILED GRAPHIC LOG WITH TEXT DESCRIPTION LINKS TO RAW DATA AND PHOTOGRAPHS WILL BE CREATED.DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: WIKI PAGE(S), SCANS OF CORE AND SAMPLES, X-RAY FLUORESCENCE DATAINTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES): EARTH MRI RESEARCHERSSUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES. NONE

PROJECT TITLE: ARKANSAS CORE AND CUTTINGS PRESERVATION AND ZINC BOREHOLE DATA   GEOCHEMICAL ANALYSES INITIATIVESAWARD PURPOSE: THE RECIPIENT WILL PREPARE EXISTING CORE AND CUTTINGS IN THE NORMAN F. WILLIAMS WELL SAMPLE LIBRARY FOR RELOCATION AND STORAGE AT A FUTURE LOCATION. THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSESS CONDITION OF BOXES THAT CONTAIN AND PRESERVE CORE AND CUTTINGS SAMPLES. ONCE THE BOXES ARE ASSESSED, THOSE THAT ARE BADLY DAMAGED WILL BE REPLACED. A DIGITAL LABELING AND INVENTORY MANAGEMENT SYSTEM WILL BE ACQUIRED TO CATALOGUE EACH INDIVIDUAL BOX CONTAINING CORE OR CUTTINGS FOR PRESERVATION AND IMPROVED PUBLIC ACCESS. WE WILL ALSO SUBMIT UP TO 200 SAMPLES FOR GEOCHEMICAL ANALYSIS FROM CORE AND CUTTINGS AND FIELD COLLECTIONS AND SUBMIT DATA FROM LEAD AND ZINC EXPLORATION CORES INTO A BOREHOLE TEMPLATE FOR UPLOAD TO RESCICOLL.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE RECIPIENT PLANS TO HIRE AN EXTRA-HELP PERSON TO: ASSESS THE BOXES THAT CONTAIN CORE AND CUTTINGS RE-BOX VULNERABLE SAMPLES RE-LABEL BOXES WITH A DIGITAL LABEL AND ENTER IN A NEW INVENTORY SYSTEMPRIORITY 3  THE ARKANSAS OFFICE OF THE STATE GEOLOGIST PLANS TO HIRE AN EXTRA-HELP GEOLOGIST TO COMPILE BOREHOLE DATA FROM: 43 BOREHOLES OF HAND-DRAWN LITHOLOGY COLUMNS 13 VERY DETAILED CORE DESCRIPTIONS 37 HAND-WRITTEN BOREHOLE DESCRIPTIONSTHE RECIPIENT INTENDS TO SUBMIT UP TO 200 SAMPLES, 50 GRAMS PER SAMPLE OF CORE, CUTTINGS, OR IN-HOUSE FIELD SAMPLES RELATED TO CRITICAL MINERAL RESOURCES FOR GEOCHEMICAL ANALYSIS.DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES:  INCLUDE A BOREHOLE DATABASE TEMPLATE WITH A MINIMUM OF 93 BOREHOLES AND A SPREADSHEET OF METADATA FOR EACH SAMPLE SUBMITTED FOR GEOCHEMICAL ANALYSIS. THE ARKANSAS OFFICE OF THE STATE GEOLOGIST EXPECTS TO RE-BOX APPROXIMATELY 700 BOXES AND GET STARTED ON THE NEW DIGITAL LABELING AND INVENTORY SYSTEM.BENEFICIARIES:  STATE AGENCIES SUCH AS ARKANSAS DEPARTMENTS OF HEALTH, ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY, AND THE HIGHWAY DEPARTMENT  LOCAL PUBLIC WATER SYSTEM MANAGERS AND USERS, PRIVATE COMPANIES THAT PRODUCE NATURAL RESOURCES INCLUDING THE OIL AND GAS INDUSTRY, AND UNIVERSITY RESEARCHERS. LANDOWNERS AND DEVELOPERS ALSO BENEFIT FROM INFORMATION ABOUT RESOURCES THAT ARE ON THEIR PROPERTY.SUBRECIPIENTS: N A

PROJECT TITLE: PRESERVING AND INVENTORYING KANSAS GEOLOGIC DATA, DOCUMENTS, SAMPLES, AND AERIAL PHOTOGRAPHS  AND SURVEYING DRILL HOLE CORE HOLDINGS RELATING TO CRITICAL MINERAL RESOURCES, FY2023PROJECT PERIOD: 8 18 2023 THROUGH 8 17 2026PRIORITY 1  PRESERVE GEOSCIENCE DATA AND MATERIALTHE KANSAS GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (KGS), THE STATE REPOSITORY FOR GEOLOGIC RECORDS, HAS A LONG HISTORY OF PROVIDING GEOLOGIC RECORDS TO THE PUBLIC FOR LITTLE OR NO COST. THIS YEARS PROJECTS CONSIST OF THREE PRESERVATION PROJECTS THAT CONTINUE WORK PREVIOUSLY FUNDED BY THE NATIONAL GEOLOGICAL AND GEOPHYSICAL DATA PRESERVATION PROGRAM. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE INDEPENDENT GEOLOGISTS, ENVIRONMENTAL CONSULTANTS, INDUSTRY OPERATORS AND DRILLERS, DATA VENDORS, INVESTORS, LAWYERS, PRIVATE LANDOWNERS, STATE REGIONAL LOCAL TRIBAL AGENCIES, AND ACADEMIA. THE GEOLOGIC DATA IS USED IN PLANNING PUBLIC INFRASTRUCTURE, IDENTIFYING METHANE GAS LEAKS, LOCATING CRITICAL MINERALS, AND CORRELATING THE STATES STRATIGRAPHY. REGULATORY AGENCIES AND ENVIRONMENTAL FIRMS USE OUR DATA IN THEIR RESEARCH. ADDITIONALLY, THE KGS CREATES ENTRIES IN THEIR DATABASE WHERE NO RECORDS EXIST AIDING WITH IDENTIFYING WELL CUTTINGS AND CORE IN THEIR REPOSITORIES WHICH BENEFIT STAKEHOLDERS AND HELPS PROTECT OUR NATURAL RESOURCES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED PRIORITY 1: THE KGS HAS THREE PRESERVATION PROJECTS FOR FY23. IN PROJECT 1, THE KGS STAFF, WITH STUDENT ASSISTANCE, WILL SCAN 10,000 OIL AND GAS WELL COMPLETION AND DRILLERS REPORTS, WIRELINE AND STRIP LOGS, AND OTHER GEOLOGICAL REPORTS AND MAKE THEM AVAILABLE ON OUR WEBSITE. THE STAFF WILL ALSO ORGANIZE AND INVENTORY ADDITIONAL RECORDS. THE KANSAS STATUTE MANDATES THAT THE KANSAS GEOLOGIC SAMPLE REPOSITORY (KGSR) COLLECTS, PRESERVES, AND SUPPLIES PUBLIC ACCESS TO OIL AND GAS WELL SAMPLES  THEREFORE, FOR PROJECT 2, THE KGSR STAFF PLAN TO PROCESS 9,000 WELL CUTTING SAMPLES. IN THE FINAL PRESERVATION PROJECT, PROJECT 3, STUDENTS WILL SCAN 25,000 IMAGES TO OUR WORK-IN PROGRESS DATABASE OF 45,000 HISTORICAL AERIAL PHOTOGRAPHS. THESE SCANS WILL BE CONVERTED TO PDFS AND JPGS AND WILL BE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC TO VIEW AND DOWNLOAD.PRIORITY 2  DIGITAL AND PHYSICAL INFRASTRUCTURE DEVELOPMENTTHIS INFRASTRUCTURE FUNDING REQUEST WILL ALLOW THE KGS COMPUTER SERVICES STAFF TO MODIFY THEIR DIGITAL INFRASTRUCTURE TO IMPROVE PRESERVATION AND DATA RETRIEVAL FOR THE PUBLIC. THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT OIL AND GAS STAKEHOLDERS, WHO HAVE SPECIFICALLY REQUESTED THESE ITEMS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED PRIORITY 2: IN THIS PRIORITY, THE KGS STAFF WILL ALTER THEIR PUBLIC OIL AND GAS WELL DATABASE TO ALLOW FOR THE CREATION AND IMPORTATION OF NEWLY CALIBRATED LOGS FOR PRESERVATION. PRIORITY 3  CRITICAL MINERALS DATA PRESERVATIONTHE KGSS DRILL CORE REPOSITORY HOUSES APPROXIMATELY 69,000 BOXES OF CORE WITH POTENTIAL TO IDENTIFY AND RESEARCH CRITICAL MINERAL DEPOSITS WITHIN THE STATE. THIS PROJECT BENEFITS VARIOUS PEOPLE INCLUDING THOSE WORKING ON EARTH MRI, THE KGS INTERNAL SCIENTISTS, AND OTHERS RESEARCHING CRITICAL MINERALS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED PRIORITY 3: THIS WORK CONTINUES THE NGGDPP FY22 GRANT OF INVENTORYING, DATA CLEANUP, PHOTOGRAPHING, AND SAMPLING SELECTED KGS DRILL CORES IDENTIFIED AS HAVING CRITICAL MINERAL POTENTIAL WITH AN ADDED EMPHASIS ON CORES THAT CONTAIN AN ASH LAYER. SAMPLES WILL BE SENT TO THE USGS FOR GEOCHEMICAL ANALYSIS WITH RESULTS UPLOADED TO RESCICOLL AND OUR PUBLIC OIL AND GAS WELL DATABASE.

PROJECT TITLE: GWS FAIR DATA INITIATIVE 2023-2024  LEGACY RESEARCH ACCESS AND PUBLIC OUTREACHPROJECT PERIOD: 7 1 2023 THROUGH 6 30 2025AWARD DESCRIPTION: (1) EXTEND OUR RECORD CENTER STORAGE TO INCLUDE SAFE HOUSING FOR MAPS  (2) SUPPORT USGS STATEMAP RESEARCH BY CREATING DIGITALLY SEARCHABLE HISTORICAL RECORDS  AND (3) MAKE IMAGES AND RECORDS OF OUR HANDS-ON EDUCATION COLLECTION SPECIMENS AVAILABLE ONLINE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: ARCHIVES AND COLLECTIONS STAFF WILL CATALOG FIELD MAPS AND ORGANIZE THEM BY GEOGRAPHIC LOCATION. THEY WILL MOVE THE MAPS INTO NEW FLAT FILE CABINETS IN THE RECORD CENTER ANNEX AND SEPARATE MAP GROUPS WITH SHEETS OF ACID-FREE ARCHIVAL CARDBOARD. EACH SHEET OF CARDBOARD WILL HAVE AN ATTACHED LABEL TAB. NOTEBOOKS WILL BE PLACED IN ACID-FREE CARDBOARD SLIPCASES AND HOUSED IN THE CENTRAL RECORD CENTER. DIGITAL COLLECTIONS STAFF WILL SCAN FIELD MAPS, FIELD NOTEBOOKS, AND GAMMA LOGS WITH HANDWRITTEN NOTES  CREATE PHOTOGRAPHS OF EDUCATION COLLECTION SPECIMENS  AND SORT AND ORGANIZE EXISTING DIGITAL FILES. THEY WILL MOVE THE DIGITAL FILES INTO AN ONLINE RESOURCE SYSTEM CALLED CARST (COLLECTIVEACCESS-RESOURCESPACE TANDEM) AND CREATE SEARCHABLE RECORDS THAT ARE VISIBLE TO THE PUBLIC. EDUCATION AND OUTREACH STAFF WILL DOCUMENT ACTIVITIES AND PROVIDE PUBLIC UPDATES THROUGH OUR SURVEY NEWSLETTER AND SOCIAL MEDIA.DELIVERABLES, IMPACT, AND BENEFICIARIES: THE ON-SITE RECORDS CENTER IS A SPACE SAFE FOR VALUABLE GEOLOGICAL RECORDS AND COMFORTABLE FOR ANYONE WHO WANTS TO USE THEM. THE NEW FLAT FILE CABINETS AND NOTEBOOK COVERS WILL BETTER PRESERVE, ORGANIZE, AND EXTEND THE LIFE OF THE RECORDS BY PROTECTING THEM FROM LIGHT, DUST, AND WEAR AND TEAR, WHILE SLOWING THE NATURAL AGEING OF THE PAPER. TRANSCRIBING THE HANDWRITING IN NOTEBOOKS OR ON FIELD MAPS AND GAMMA LOGS LETS COMPUTERS READ THE TEXT. ADDING RECORDS AND PHOTOGRAPHS TO CARST GIVES SCIENTISTS AND THE PUBLIC ACCESS TO RESOURCES THAT WERE HARD TO FIND OR NOT AVAILABLE BEFORE. ONCE IN THE SYSTEM, THE FILES CAN BE EASILY SEARCHED FOR, MANAGED, AND PROTECTED FROM LOSS. THIS PUBLIC DATA PROVIDES USERS OF ALL AGES AND BACKGROUNDS WITH NEW GATEWAYS TO EXPLORE EARTH SCIENCE ON A LOCAL, REGIONAL, OR GLOBAL SCALE.SUBRECIPIENTS: N A

PROJECT TITLE: UGS FY2023 GEOLOGIC DATA PRESERVATION PROJECTPROJECT PERIOD: 7 1 2023 THROUGH 6 30 2024AWARD PURPOSE: THE UTAH GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (UGS) PROVIDES TIMELY, OBJECTIVE SCIENTIFIC INFORMATION ABOUT UTAH S GEOLOGIC ENVIRONMENT, RESOURCES, AND HAZARDS TO ALL UTAHNS TO IMPROVE THEIR LIVES THROUGH INFORMED DECISION MAKING. PRESERVING AND ENABLING EASY ACCESS TO THESE MATERIALS IS CRITICAL TO THE LONG-TERM SURVIVAL OF IMPORTANT GEOLOGIC DATA, ENABLING AND IMPROVING NATURAL RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP, LOWERING DEVELOPMENT AND INFRASTRUCTURE COSTS, PROTECTING THE PUBLIC FROM GEOLOGIC HAZARDS, AND FULFILLING OUR STATUTORY MISSION. IT IS CRITICAL THAT THIS DATA BE CATALOGED AND PRESERVED FOR CURRENT AND FUTURE USE, AS DEMANDS FOR NATURAL RESOURCES, DEVELOPMENT IN GEOLOGICALLY HAZARDOUS AREAS, AND ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES INCREASE. THIS PROJECT WILL ENABLE THE UGS TO CATALOG AND DIGITALLY CONVERT A PORTION OF OUR UNIQUE HOLDINGS FOR EASIER ACCESS BY USERS, AS WELL AS PRESERVING THEM LONG-TERM FOR THE FUTURE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE UGS PROPOSES TO EXTRACT BORING LOG DATA AND UPDATE THE UTAH SUBSURFACE GEOTECHNICAL DATABASE  DIGITIZE GROUNDWATER DATA  SCAN AND CATALOG GEOLOGIC, GEOLOGIC HAZARD, AND MINERAL RELATED MAPS AND DOCUMENTS THAT WILL BE AVAILABLE THROUGH VARIOUS DATABASES ON THE UGS WEBSITE (HTTPS:  GEOLOGY.UTAH.GOV APPS INTGEOMAP, HTTPS:  GEOLOGY.UTAH.GOV APPS ROCKCORE, HTTPS:  GEODATA.GEOLOGY.UTAH.GOV)  DIGITIZE HISTORICAL AERIAL PHOTOGRAPHY FILM ROLLS WITH DATA AVAILABLE IN THE UTAH AERIAL IMAGERY DATABASE (HTTPS:  IMAGERY.GEOLOGY.UTAH.GOV)  PHOTOGRAPH DRILL CORE HOUSED AT THE UGS UTAH CORE RESEARCH CENTER AND CREATE SUMMARY DESCRIPTIONS OF DRILL CORE WITH DATA AVAILABLE AT HTTPS:  GEOLOGY.UTAH.GOV APPS ROCKCORE  IDENTIFY POTENTIALLY PROBLEMATIC GEOGRAPHIC PLACE NAMES IN UTAH  SUBMIT 200 CRITICAL MINERAL RELATED SAMPLES TO THE U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (USGS) FOR GEOCHEMICAL ANALYSIS  AND PURCHASE ROCK PROCESSING AND LOGGING EQUIPMENT AS PART OF THIS PROJECT.DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: DELIVERABLES PROPOSED FROM THIS PROJECT INCLUDE THE SUBMITTAL OF ITEM-LEVEL METADATA, AS APPROPRIATE, AND A FINAL TECHNICAL REPORT DESCRIBING THE PROJECT AND ITS RESULTS AND TO THE USGS, ALONG WITH UPDATING VARIOUS UGS ONLINE DATABASES LISTED ABOVE.INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES): INDUSTRY, CONSULTANTS, GOVERNMENT AGENCIES (FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL), ACADEMIA, EDUCATORS, STUDENTS, AND THE PUBLIC CURRENTLY USE COLLECTIONS AND DATA HELD BY THE UGS IN A VARIETY OF PROJECTS AND PROGRAMS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: TO BE AS COST-EFFECTIVE AS POSSIBLE, WE PLAN TO CONTINUE UTILIZING DIGITAL SCANNING (DOCUMENTS, LARGE FORMAT SHEETS MAPS, PHOTOGRAPHS, SLIDES, ETC.) AND DATA ENTRY SERVICES (METADATA) PROVIDED BY UTAH CORRECTIONAL INDUSTRIES IN SALT LAKE CITY, UTAH.

PROJECT TITLE: GEOPHYSICAL LOG PRESERVATION   BOUNDARY MONUMENTS IMAGERY   RESSCICOLL UPDATESPROJECT PERIOD: 7 1 2023 THROUGH 6 30 2024THE MAIN PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PRESERVE AND PROVIDE PUBLIC ACCESS TO BOREHOLE GEOPHYSICAL LOGS AVAILABLE TO THE DELAWARE GEOLOGICAL SURVEY. THE PROJECT WILL PRESERVE LOG DATA IN STANDARD LAS AND PDF FORMATS AND SERVE THEM ON A NEW DGS BOREHOLE DATA SERVICE WEB PORTAL. A SECONDARY PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO UPDATE METADATA RECORDS FOR ALL DELAWARE GEOLOGICAL SURVEY COLLECTIONS FROM PREVIOUS PROJECTS TO THE NEW REGISTRY OF SCIENTIFIC COLLECTIONS STANDARD.THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ON THE GEOPHYSICAL LOGS COMPONENT WILL 1) PRESERVE AND ORGANIZE GEOPHYSICAL LOG IN STANDARD FORMATS, 2) EVALUATE AND ASSIGN QUALITY RATINGS, AND 3) MAKE THEM AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC ON THE WEB. GEOPHYSICAL LOG HOLDINGS WILL BE COMPARED TO EXISTING INVENTORIES, ASSESSED, AND RATED FOR QUALITY. THOSE OF ADEQUATE QUALITY FROM BOREHOLES OF GREATER THAN 150 FT DEPTH IN THE COASTAL PLAIN WILL BE EDITED AND OR RE-DIGITIZED WHERE NECESSARY. ONE LOG PER TOOL TYPE IN EACH BOREHOLE WILL BE PRESERVED IN STANDARD LAS FILE FORMAT AND A STANDARDIZED PDF DISPLAY FORMAT. PUBLIC ACCESS WILL BE PROVIDED THROUGH THE DELAWARE GEOLOGICAL SURVEY BOREHOLE DATA VIEWER, A BOREHOLE DATA MAPPING APPLICATION UNDER DEVELOPMENT FOR OUR FY2022 PROJECT. THE ACTIVITIES ASSOCIATED WITH THE METADATA UPDATE WILL INCLUDE REVIEW OF PREVIOUS METADATA SUBMISSIONS, COMPILATION OF NEW DATA TO BE SUBMITTED, AND FORMATTING OF THESE DATA ACCORDING TO THE NEW REGISTRY OF SCIENTIFIC COLLECTIONS STANDARD.DELIVERABLES PLANNED FOR THE GEOPHYSICAL LOG COMPONENT OF THIS PROJECT ARE: 1. BOREHOLE SITE AND GEOPHYSICAL LOG DATA ADDED OR VERIFIED AND UPDATED AS NEEDED IN THE WATSYS WELL AND GEOPHYSICAL TABLES (800 SITES, 1400 LOGS)  2. CATALOGUED SET OF BOREHOLE GEOPHYSICAL LOG PDF IMAGES AND LAS FORMAT FILES FOR THESE LOGS  AND 3. GEOPHYSICAL LOG LINKS WITHIN SITE POP-UPS ON THE NEW PUBLICLY ACCESSIBLE DGS BOREHOLE MAPPING APPLICATION HOSTED ON ESRI S ARCGIS ONLINE. THE WELL-CURATED COLLECTION OF GEOPHYSICAL LOG PRODUCTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC ON A WEB PORTAL WILL BE OF SIGNIFICANT BENEFIT TO DGS SCIENTISTS AND TO STAKEHOLDERS INCLUDING STATE AGENCIES, LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, AND PRIVATE ENTERPRISE IN INVESTIGATIONS OF THE SUBSURFACE GEOLOGY OF THE DELAWARE COASTAL PLAIN AND RELATED PLANNING AND WATER RESOURCE MANAGEMENT DECISIONS. THE DELIVERABLE FROM THE METADATA COMPONENT OF THE PROJECT WILL BE AN UPDATED SET OF METADATA RECORDS IN THE REGISTRY OF SCIENTIFIC COLLECTIONS STANDARD THAT WILL BENEFIT BOTH USGS AND DGS BY ENSURING COMPLETE, UP-TO-DATE PROJECT METADATA ARE AVAILABLE ONLINE FORMATTED TO THE NEW REGISTRY OF SCIENTIFIC COLLECTIONS STANDARD.

PROJECT TITLE: FY23 MINNESOTA GEOLOGICAL AND GEOPHYSICAL DATA PRESERVATION PROGRAMPROJECT PERIOD: 7 1 2023 THROUGH 6 30 2024DESCRIPTION OF PURPOSE: THE ACTIVITY PROPOSED BY UNIVERSITY OF MINNESOTA, MINNESOTA GEOLOGICAL SURVEY, FOR COMPLETION IN 2023 2024, WITH SUPPORT FROM THE UNITED STATES GEOLOGICAL SURVEY, NATIONAL GEOLOGICAL AND GEOPHYSICAL DATA PRESERVATION PROGRAM, IS MEANT TO BE AN ANNUAL INCREMENT TOWARD EFFORT FIRST AUTHORIZED BY THE ENERGY POLICY ACT OF 2005, THAT IS MEANT TO ENSURE THE PRESERVATION AND AVAILABILITY OF PUBLIC GEOSCIENCE OBSERVATIONS SUCH AS GEOLOGISTS  DESCRIPTIONS, MEASUREMENTS SUCH AS GEOPHYSICAL AND GEOCHEMICAL DETERMINATIONS, AND SPECIMENS SUCH AS SEDIMENTS AND ROCKS, THAT ARE NEEDED BY SOCIETY TO ENSURE OPTIMAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT, HAZARDS RESILIENCE, AND TO SUPPORT RESEARCH ON THE PLANET AND ITS LIFE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE WORK PROPOSED FOR THIS COMING YEAR ADDRESSES ADMINISTRATION PRIORITIES REGARDING THE ECONOMY, AND PROGRAM PRIORITIES REGARDING PRESERVATION, GEOSCIENCE INFRASTRUCTURE, AND RESOURCES. THE WORK WILL BE CARRIED OUT BY MINNESOTA GEOLOGICAL SURVEY OF THE UNIVERSITY OF MINNESOTA, IN COOPERATION WITH THE NATURAL RESOURCES RESEARCH INSTITUTE OF THE UNIVERSITY OF MINNESOTA DULUTH, AND THE MINNESOTA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES. THE WORK INCLUDES DEVELOPING GEOPHYSICAL DATABASES, ENHANCED STORAGE OF CUTTINGS, CATALOGING OF ROCKS, SUBMISSION OF LITHOGEOCHEMICAL SPECIMENS, AND STRATEGIC PLANNING.DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE DELIVERABLES WILL BE IMPROVED GEOPHYSICAL DATABASES, ENHANCED STORAGE OF CUTTINGS, A CATALOG OF ROCKS, SUBMISSION OF LITHOGEOCHEMICAL SPECIMENS, AND UPDATED STRATEGIC PLANNING. THE OUTCOMES WILL BE BETTER PUBLIC INFORMATION AND PLANNING FOR GEOSCIENCE OBSERVATIONS, MEASUREMENTS, AND COLLECTIONS NEEDED BY THE PEOPLE OF MINNESOTA TO SUPPORT RESOURCE MANAGEMENT, HAZARDS RESILIENCE, AND RESEARCH.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PEOPLE OF MINNESOTA.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE NATURAL RESOURCES RESEARCH INSTITUTE OF THE UNIVERSITY OF MINNESOTA DULUTH WILL FOCUS ON THE ROCK CATALOG, LITHOGEOCHEMISTRY SAMPLES, AS WELL AS STRATEGIC PLANNING. THE MINNESOTA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES, WHILE NOT DIRECTLY FUNDED BY THIS PROPOSAL, WILL BE CONSULTED ON LITHOGEOCHEMISTRY SAMPLING AND STRATEGIC PLANNING.SUBRECIPIENTS: N A

PROJECT TITLE: WASHINGTON DATA PRESERVATION 20232025PROJECT PERIOD: 7 1 2023 THROUGH 6 30 2025PRIORITY 1 WILL BE BROKEN INTO TWO PROJECTS, A AND B:.  AWARD PURPOSEPROJECT ADIGITIZE BOREHOLE RECORDS COLLECTED BY THE WASHINGTON GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (WGS) AND MAKE THEM AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMEDTHE DIGITIZATION PROCESS INVOLVES GEOREFERENCING PREVIOUSLY SCANNED PROJECT MAPS TO OBTAIN ACCURATE BOREHOLE LOCATIONS IN GIS, ATTRIBUTING TABULAR DATA, SUCH AS GEOLOGIC CONDITIONS RECORDED IN THE BOREHOLE LOG, THEN APPENDING THE PRODUCED RECORDS TO OUR STATEWIDE SUBSURFACE DATABASE AND ADDING METADATA RECORDS FOR EACH IN THE NATIONAL BOREHOLE INVENTORY AND RESCICOLL. DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMESPROVIDE REPORTS DIGITALLY, ALONG WITH QUERYABLE ATTRIBUTES, IN A PUBLIC-FACING DATASET. THIS DATASET IS ONE OF THE MOST POPULAR AT THE SURVEY, RECEIVING ON AVERAGE A THOUSAND UNIQUE VISITS PER MONTH ON OUR WEBSITE. THIS DATASET WILL ALLOW OTHERS TO SAVE TIME AND MONEY ON PROJECTS BY BETTER UNDERSTANDING SUBSURFACE CONDITIONS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIESENGINEERS, GEOLOGISTS, PLANNERS, HOMEOWNERS, STUDENTS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIESN A AWARD PURPOSEPROJECT BTO CONTINUE A PREVIOUS YEARS EFFORT TO SCAN AND GEOREFERENCE THE SURVEYS THIN SECTION COLLECTION. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMEDCOMPLETE SCANNING OF HISTORICAL SAMPLES AND SCAN RECENTLY COLLECTED SAMPLES FROM THE MOST RECENT MAPPING PROJECTS. AS MANY AS CAN BE LOCATED WILL BE GEOREFERENCED AS TIME ALLOWS. THE ENTIRETY OF THE COLLECTIONS METADATA WILL THEN BE UPLOADED TO RESCICOLL. DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMESTHE FINAL PRODUCT WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE ON THE RECIPIENT S WEBSITE AS A WEB SERVICE AND ALL IMAGES AND MAP DATA ARE AVAILABLE FOR DOWNLOAD. INTENDED BENEFICIARIESGEOLOGISTS, STUDENTS, GENERAL PUBLIC SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIESN APRIORITY 2 AWARD PURPOSE IMPROVE WGS DIGITAL INFRASTRUCTURE BY PURCHASING AN IMPROVED CAPACITY SCANNER. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMEDPURCHASE NEW SCANNER. DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMESTHIS NEW PURCHASE WILL KEEP PRESERVATION GOING INTO THE FUTURE. THIS PURCHASE WILL ALLOW WGS TO MAKE AS MANY SCANS AS POSSIBLE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC. INTENDED BENEFICIARIESGEOLOGISTS, STUDENTS, GENERAL PUBLIC SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIESN A

PROJECT TITLE: NGGDPP CORE PHOTOGRAPHY AND INFRASTRUCTURE AND CRITICAL MINERALSPROJECT PERIOD: 7 14 2023 THROUGH 7 13 2026AWARD PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO UPDATE NEW MEXICO BUREAU OF GEOLOGY AND MINERAL RESOURCES (NMBGMR) DATA IN USGS DATA REPOSITORY AND TO CONTINUE FUNDING EARTHMRI CRITICAL MINERAL RESEARCH TO INCLUDE ZINC AND NICKEL.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: PRIORITY 1 ACTIVITIES OF UPDATING THE USGS DATA REPOSITORY RESCICOLL WILL BE CONDUCTED BY ONE TO TWO STUDENTS AND THE PRINCIPLE INVESTIGATOR. DATA WILL BE FORMATTED USING USGS METADATA STANDARDS FOR UPLOAD. THERE ARE 27 COLLECTIONS WITH OVER 100000 RECORDS TO VERIFY DATA AND FORMULATE FOLLOWING THE NEW STANDARDS. PRIORITY 3 WILL CONTINUE PAST YEAR S WORKS CREATING DATABASE OF MINING DISTRICTS, GEOCHEMICAL ANALYSIS, DESCRIBING MINERALIZATION IN CORE, AND INVENTORYING PHYSICAL SAMPLES IN NMBGMR S REPOSITORY. NEW WORK WILL BE CONDUCTED FOCUSING ON BRINES, PLAYA LAKES AND SEDIMENTARY ROCKS NOT LOCATED IN MINING DISTRICTS.DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES: PRIORITY 1 FUNDING WILL PROVIDE FUNDS FOR UPDATES TO OUR RECORDS METADATA TO ADD TO USGS  S DATA CATALOG. USGS SCHEMA AND METADATA STANDARDS WILL BE USED. BY UPDATING THE RECORDS WE CAN PROVIDE MORE ACCESS POINTS FOR OTHER SCIENTISTS TO FIND OUR DATA FOR USE IN THEIR RESEARCH. PRIORITY 3 IS A CONTINUATION OF PAST RESEARCH ADDING ZINC AND NICKEL LOCATED IN BRINES, PLAYA LAKES, AND SEDIMENTARY ROCKS NOT ASSOCIATED WITH MINING DISTRICTS. PI WILL REVISE THE LONG-RANGE PLAN STARTED IN 2021 (YEAR 3). CONTINUING ACTIVITIES ARE: COMPILING OF A COMPREHENSIVE DATABASE OF MINING DISTRICTS IN THE STATE, COMPILING GEOCHEMICAL ANALYSIS FOR CHARACTERIZATION OF DEPOSITS, PHOTOGRAPHING AND DESCRIBING CORE, AND INVENTORYING PHYSICAL SAMPLES STORED IN THE STATE SURVEY. NEW ACTIVITIES WILL BE SAMPLING CRITICAL MINERAL SAMPLES BY USGS, PREPARING A COMPREHENSIVE REPORT ON  RARE EARTH ELEMENTS (REE) IN NEW MEXICO  THAT WILL BE PUBLISHED AS AN NMBGMR OPEN-FILE REPORT, UPLOAD FIELD PHOTOS AND CORE PHOTOS FUNDED BY USGS, AND CONDUCT OUTREACH ABOUT CRITICAL MINERALS FOR THE PUBLIC. FINAL TECHNICAL REPORT.V.T. MCLEMORE (PI) WILL COMPLETE THE FINAL TECHNICAL REPORT AS OUTLINED IN THE CONTRACT.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: PRIORITY 1 METADATA UPDATE AND UPLOAD TO RESCICOLL WILL BENEFIT GEOLOGIC RESEARCH BEING CONDUCTED IN THE UNITED STATES CONCERNING NEW MEXICO. THIS DATA ALLOWS FOR RESEARCHERS TO FOCUS THEIR RESEARCH AND NOT REPLICATE ALREADY CONDUCTED RESEARCH BY CREATING A CATALOG OF SOME OF THE INFORMATION AVAILABLE AT NMBGMR. PRIORITY 3 WILL PROVIDE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE STATE OF NEW MEXICO IN THE RECOVERY OF CRITICAL MINERALS FROM EXISTING MINE WASTES AND NEW OPPORTUNITIES IN PREVIOUSLY UNDISCOVERED AREAS OF THE STATE. THIS DATA WILL ALSO HELP LEGISLATURE AND COMPANIES FIND AREAS OF INTEREST FOR FURTHER REGULATION AND EXPLORATION.SUB RECIPIENT ACTIVITIES, IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT THE TIME OF AWARD: NONE

PROJECT TITLE: GENERATING METADATA RECORDS AND DIGITIZING DOCUMENTS IN THE COAL GEOLOGY MAPS COLLECTION, DIGITIZING ONE UNPUBLISHED 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLE GEOLOGIC MAP TO LEVEL 3 GEMS, INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS FOR THE STORAGE AND ACCESSIBILITY OF THE ROCK CORE COLLECTION, USING ARCGIS ONLINE TO ENHANCE DISCOVERABILITY OF TENNESSEE GEOLOGICAL SURVEY COLLECTIONS, AND COMPILING CRITICAL MINERAL BOREHOLE DATA FOR THE EARTH MRI EAST TENNESSEE COPPER RIDGE DISTRICT FOCUS AREAPROJECT PERIOD  7 1 2023 THROUGH 6 30 2024AWARD PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE PRESERVATION, THE CATALOGING, AND IMPROVE THE PUBLICS AWARENESS OF THESE VALUABLE GEOLOGICAL RESOURCES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THERE ARE SIX SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES THAT WILL BE COMPLETED: (1) COMPILE THE ITEM LEVEL METADATA AND SCAN 500 MAPS IN TENNESSEES COAL GEOLOGY MAPS COLLECTION  (2) PREPARE THE UNPUBLISHED BRAYTON 7.5-MINUTE SCALE QUADRANGLE GEOLOGIC MAP INTO THE U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEYS GEOLOGIC MAPPING SCHEMA  (3) PRODUCE AN ARCGIS ONLINE WEB MAP APPLICATION POPULATED WITH INFORMATION FROM THE TENNESSEE COLLECTION OF ZINC MINING MAPS AND REPORTS  (4) INSTALL STEEL SHELVING CORE STORAGE RACKS IN THE ELLINGTON WAREHOUSE IN NASHVILLE TO STORE APPROXIMATELY 25,000 FEET OF ROCK CORE IN THE TENNESSEE ROCK CORE COLLECTION  (5) TO COMPILE DATA FOR APPROXIMATELY 400 MINERAL TEST HOLES IN THE COPPER RIDGE ZINC DISTRICT IN EAST TENNESSEE USING THE PRESCRIBED BOREHOLE METADATA TEMPLATE  AND (6) TO UPDATE TENNESSEES ITEM LEVEL METADATA ON THE REGISTRY OF SCIENTIFIC COLLECTIONS TO THE NEW STANDARDS.DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: BY THE END OF THE AWARD PERIOD, WE EXPECT TO (1) ADD THE ITEM LEVEL METADATA FOR THE 500 MAPS IN THE TENNESSEE COAL GEOLOGY MAPS COLLECTION TO THE CURRENT DATASET ON THE REGISTRY OF SCIENTIFIC COLLECTIONS, AND TO HAVE ALL OF THE MAPS SCANNED IN PREPARATION FOR MAKING THEM ACCESSIBLE ON THE SURVEYS FILENET WEBSITE  (2) UPLOAD THE GEOLOGIC MAP SCHEMA DATABASES AND PORTABLE DOCUMENT FORMAT FILE FOR THE BRAYTON QUADRANGLE GEOLOGIC MAP TO THE NATIONAL COOPERATIVE GEOLOGIC MAPPING PROGRAM PORTAL  (3) GO-LIVE WITH A PUBLIC- FACING ARCGIS ONLINE WEB MAP APPLICATION PILOT-PROJECT HOSTING INFORMATION FROM THE TENNESSEE COLLECTION OF ZINC MINING MAPS AND REPORTS  (4) HAVE INSTALLED NEW CORE SHELVING IN THE ELLINGTON WAREHOUSE AND HAVE ALL THE CORE CURRENTLY ON THE FLOOR STORED ON THEM  (5) HAVE COMPILED THE LOCATION DATA, STRATIGRAPHIC INFORMATION, AND MINERALIZATION DATA FOR APPROXIMATELY 400 MINERAL TEST HOLES IN THE COPPER RIDGE ZINC DISTRICT IN EAST TENNESSEE USING THE PRESCRIBED BOREHOLE METADATA TEMPLATE, AND TO UPLOAD THE SPREADSHEET FILE TO THE REGISTRY OF SCIENTIFIC COLLECTIONS  AND (6) COMPLETE THE REQUIRED UPDATES TO THE NEW ITEM LEVEL METADATA CONVENTION FOR THE REGISTRY OF SCIENTIFIC COLLECTIONS TO IMPROVE THE DISCOVERABILITY OF 12,250 CHILD ITEMS IN THE TENNESSEE GEOLOGICAL SURVEYS COLLECTIONS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS EFFORT WILL BENEFIT THE PUBLIC, INDUSTRY, AND AGENCIES AT ALL LEVELS OF GOVERNMENT, BECAUSE IT WILL PRESERVE, CATALOG, AND DISSEMINATE GEOLOGIC DATA OF SIGNIFICANT VALUE THAT HAS THE POTENTIAL TO CONTRIBUTE TO A WIDE-RANGE OF CURRENT SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC PRIORITIES. REACQUIRING THE DATA WOULD REQUIRE A SUBSTANTIAL INVESTMENT IN TIME, MONEY, AND EFFORT TO REPLICATE. LAND USE PLANNING WILL BENEFIT FROM KNOWLEDGE OF POTENTIAL GEOLOGIC HAZARDS, SUCH AS ABANDONED UNDERGROUND COAL MINES. THE U.S. GEOFRAMEWORK INITIATIVE TO PRODUCE A SEAMLESS NATIONAL GEOLOGIC MAP NEEDS ACCESS TO DIGITAL GEOLOGIC MAP PRODUCTS. EASY ACCESS TO SUBSURFACE DATABASES AND CORE SAMPLES WILL HELP THE EARTH MAPPING RESOURCES INITIATIVE TO IDENTIFY AREAS FOR ACTIVE EXPLORATION AND POTENTIAL FUTURE MINING FOR CRITICAL MINERALS NEEDS.

PROJECT TITLE: CONVERSION OF ENVIRONMENTAL GEOLOGY AND STATE GEOLOGICAL MAPS, GEOTECHNICAL REPORT SCANNING, INSTRUMENT INFRASTRUCTURE FOR FIELD ANALYSISPERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: 6 1 2023 THROUGH 5 31 2024AWARD PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS CONTINUE EFFORTS BY THE COLORADO GEOLOGICAL SURVEY(CGS) TO DIGITIZE PUBLICATIONS FROM THE AGENCIES PAST AND MAKE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC. THE GOAL IS TO INCREASE DIGITAL AVAILABILITY TO STAFF AND THE PUBLIC FOR EASIER DISSEMINATION. THIS PROJECT SEEKS TO HAVE A SERIES OF ENVIRONMENTAL SERIES PUBLICATIONS DIGITIZED, CONVERT PAST GEOLOGICAL HAZARD REPORTS THAT ARE SUBMITTED AND ANALYZED BY LAND USE STAFF, AND TO PURCHASE A LOG SCANNER TO DIGITIZE AN INCREASING LIBRARY OF LOGS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: PRIORITY 1 - CGS (1) WILL SCAN AND VECTORIZE SEVERAL GEOLOGIC HAZARD, GEOLOGIC, AND AGGREGATE RESOURCE MAPS IN THE COLORADO GEOLOGICAL SURVEY S ENVIRONMENTAL GEOLOGY (EG) SERIES AS WELL AS THE QC OF THESE MAPS. THESE WILL BE MADE ACCESSIBLE TO THE PUBLIC VIA THE CGS WEBSITE. THESE MAPS WILL BENEFIT LOCAL GOVERNMENTS AND RESEARCHERS THAT SPECIALIZE IN GEOLOGIC HAZARDS AND MINERAL RESOURCE INVESTIGATIONS WHO REQUIRE LEGACY GEOTECHNICAL MAPS IN GIS FORM AND (2) CONVERT GEOLOGIC MATERIALS FROM PAPER INTO DIGITAL FORMAT WITH NDC METADATA. CGS WILL MAKE THE DATA READILY ACCESSIBLE TO THE PUBLIC WHICH BENEFIT RESEARCHERS AND INVESTIGATORS. THE DATASET CONSISTS OF GEOLOGIC, GEOLOGIC HAZARD, AND GEOTECHNICAL REPORTS AND MAPS DATING FROM 1972 TO THE PRESENT COLLECTED BY THE CGS FROM SUBMITTALS OF LAND-USE EVALUATION STUDIES. THESE MATERIALS ARE IN AND WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC DOMAIN.PRIORITY 2 - CGS WILL PURCHASE A WELL-LOG SCANNER FOR RAPID AND PORTABLE SCANNING OF WELL LOGS WITHIN THE CGS ARCHIVES OR AT OFF SITE LOCATIONS. THESE SCANS WILL BE USED TO HELP CGS STAFF MAKE BETTER PRODUCTS IN THE FUTURE AND ARCHIVE PAPER WELL LOGS THAT MAY NOT EXIST IN OTHER LOCATIONS.DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  PRIORITY 1 - (1) PRODUCTS WILL BE MADE ACCESSIBLE TO THE PUBLIC VIA THE CGS WEBSITE. THESE MAPS WILL BENEFIT LOCAL GOVERNMENTS AND RESEARCHERS THAT SPECIALIZE IN GEOLOGIC HAZARDS AND MINERAL RESOURCE INVESTIGATIONS WHO REQUIRE LEGACY GEOTECHNICAL MAPS IN GIS FORM. (2) PRODUCTS WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC WHERE RESEARCHERS AND ENGINEERS CAN USE THEM TO MAKE BETTER DECISIONS IN FUTURE DEVELOPMENT PLANNING. PRIORITY 2 - CGS INTENDS TO PURCHASE A LOG SCANNER THAT WILL BETTER HELP CGS SCAN A BACKLOG OF WELL LOGS BOTH ON AND OFFSITE. THIS DATA WILL ULTIMATELY BE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES):  CGS WILL BE THE INITIAL BENEFICIARY AS THE EMPLOYEES CAN USE THE DATA BEING GENERATED IN THIS PROJECT. THE OVERALL INTENDED BENEFICIARY OF THIS DATA WILL BE THE GENERAL PUBLIC OF COLORADO AND BEYOND AND WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE FOR DOWNLOAD ON THE CGS S WEBSITE.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N A

PROJECT TITLE: DATA PRESERVATION AND CRITICAL MINERALS ACTIVITIES IN IOWA 2023-2024PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: 7 1 2023 THROUGH 6 30 2024AWARD PURPOSE: THE PRIORITY 1 PROJECT WILL BEGIN THE PROCESS OF IDENTIFYING PROCEDURES AND ESTABLISHING A FRAMEWORK THAT WILL ALLOW THE IOWA GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (ISG) AND UNIVERSITY OF IOWA PALEONTOLOGY REPOSITORY (UIPR) TO EFFECTIVELY AND EFFICIENTLY COLLABORATE, SHARE, AND INTEGRATE THEIR UNIQUE COLLECTIONS DATA THROUGH THE PRESERVATION OF THE ROBERT WOLF COLLECTION (RWC). THE PRIORITY 2 PROJECT WILL MODERNIZE THE IGS GEOSAM WEB APPLICATION TO AN ESRI ONLINE WEB MAPPING APPLICATION. THE PRIORITY 3 PROJECT WILL SUBMIT 200 PRECAMBRIAN CORE SAMPLES FOR WHOLE-ROCK GEOCHEMICAL ANALYSES RELATED TO RARE EARTH ELEMENTS.ACTIVTIES TO BE PERFORMED: FOR THE PRIORITY 1 PROJECT, THE IGS WILL REVIEW AND ENTER RWC LOCALITIES AND STRATIGRAPHY INTO ITS DATABASES. IGS AND UIPR INTERNS WILL: 1) LOCATE, LABEL, AND INVENTORY THE CURRENT LOCATION(S) OF EACH COMPONENT OF THE RWC CURRENTLY STORED IN VARIOUS ROOMS AND BUILDINGS ON THE UNIVERSITY OF IOWA CAMPUS  2) SCAN SPECIMEN CARDS AND ASSOCIATED PAPER RECORDS TO PREVENT PHYSICAL LOSS OF DATA WITHIN THE RWC  AND 3) TRANSCRIBE DATA FROM THE SCANNED CARDS INTO A SPREADSHEET. IGS OR UIPR INTERNS WILL ALSO DIGITALLY PHOTOGRAPH A SMALL PORTION OF RWC. FOR THE PRIORITY 2 PROJECT, THE IGS WILL UTILIZE THE UNIVERSITY OF IOWA ARCGIS SERVER AND ASSOCIATED PRODUCTS TO CREATE AND PUBLISH AN ESRI ONLINE APPLICATION THAT DISPLAYS GEOSAM DATA. COMPONENTS OF GEOSAM WILL ALSO BE UPDATED TO THE MOST CURRENT SOFTWARE VERSION. FOR THE PRIORITY 3 PROJECT, THE IGS WILL FOLLOW GUIDELINES OUTLINED IN PREVIOUS EARTH MRI INITIATIVES, COLLECT A MAXIMUM OF 200 SAMPLES FROM EXISTING PRECAMBRIAN CORES, AND SUBMIT THE SAMPLES TO THE USGS FOR WHOLE-ROCK GEOCHEMICAL ANALYSES.DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PRIORITY 1 PROJECT ESTABLISHES A FRAMEWORK FOR THE IGS AND UIPR TO COLLABORATE, SHARE, AND INTEGRATE THEIR GEOSCIENTIFIC COLLECTION DATA. A NEW COLLECTION IN THE REGISTRY OF SCIENTIFIC COLLECTIONS (RESCICOLL) FOR THE RWC WILL BE CREATED TO ALLOW DISCOVERY OF THE COLLECTION. THE PRIORITY 2 PROJECT CREATES A NEW ESRI ONLINE APPLICATION TO DISPLAY GEOSAM DATA. THE PRIORITY 3 PROJECT SUBMITS 200 PRECAMBRIAN CORE SAMPLES TO THE USGS FOR WHOLE-ROCK GEOCHEMICAL ANALYSES TO DOCUMENT CRITICAL MINERALS POTENTIAL PRECAMBRIAN ROCKS. A NEW COLLECTION IN RESCICOLL WILL BE CREATED TO ALLOW DISCOVERY OF THE PRECAMBRIAN ANALYSES. THE DATA WILL ALSO BE APPENDED TO IGS WEB APPLICATIONS FOR DISCOVERY. INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES): THE PRIORITY 1 PROJECT BENEFITS THE IGS AND UIPR BY ESTABLISHING HOW THE ORGANIZATIONS CAN MOST EFFECTIVELY COLLABORATE WITH ONE ANOTHER. THE DISCOVERY OF SPECIMENS SUBMITTED TO THE UIPR ALSO ALLOWS CURRENT IGS GEOLOGISTS TO EVALUATE AND REVISE CHRONOSTRATIGRAPHIC DESIGNATIONS ASSOCIATED WITH THOSE SPECIMENS. THE PRIORITY 2 PROJECT BENEFITS THE GENERAL PUBLIC BECAUSE THE NEW ESRI ONLINE APPLICATION WILL ALLOW EASIER ACCESS TO THE STATE WELL DATA. THE PRIORITY 3 PROJECT BENEFITS THE IGS BY PROVIDING DATA TO ASSESS THE CRITICAL MINERAL POTENTIAL OF PRECAMBRIAN ROCKS IN NORTHWESTERN IOWA.SUBRECIPIENTS: N A

PROJECT TITLE: HISTORICAL MINE PRODUCTION RECORDS, PHASE TWOPERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: 7 1 2023 THROUGH 7 1 2024AWARD PURPOSE: THE CALIFORNIA GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (CGS) WILL CONDUCT A PROJECT UNDER PRIORITY 1 OF THE NATIONAL GEOLOGICAL AND GEOPHYSICAL DATA PRESERVATION PROGRAM (NGGDPP) BEGINNING IN FISCAL YEAR (FY) 2023. THE CGS WAS AWARDED NGGDPP FUNDING IN FY 2021 (GRANT AWARD NUMBER G21AP10259-00) AND CONDUCTED PHASE ONE OF A DATA PRESERVATION PROJECT THAT INVENTORIED, SCANNED, AND BEGAN TRANSCRIPTION OF HISTORICAL MINE PRODUCTION RECORDS. DURING FY 2023 THE CGS WILL IMPLEMENT PHASE TWO OF THE DATA PRESERVATION PROJECT. THIS PROJECT WILL ENABLE THE CGS TO DIGITALLY CONVERT A PORTION OF OUR UNIQUE RECORD HOLDINGS FOR EASIER ACCESS BY USERS, AS WELL AS PRESERVING THEM LONG-TERM FOR THE FUTURE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: PHASE ONE OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDED SCANNING AND SUMMARIZING OVER 1,700 FRAGILE, TYPEWRITTEN, AND HANDWRITTEN PAPER DOCUMENTS FROM YEARS 1958 TO 1969. DURING THIS FIRST PHASE OF THE PROJECT, CGS STAFF TRANSCRIBED THE COUNTY, COMMODITY, AND PRODUCTION YEAR FROM THE MINE RECORDS. PHASE TWO OF THE PROJECT WILL CONTINUE TRANSCRIBING IMPORTANT INFORMATION FROM THESE RECORDS. THE CGS INTENDS TO SUPPLEMENT THE PHASE ONE EXCEL WORKSHEET WITH INFORMATION SUCH AS MINE NAME, MINE OPERATOR, AND, WHERE AVAILABLE, GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SUCH AS NEAREST TOWN, OR SECTION, TOWNSHIP AND RANGE.DELIVERABLE AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT WILL SATISFY THE PRIORITY 1 OBJECTIVE TO INVENTORY, PRESERVE, ARCHIVE, AND OR MODERNIZE GEOLOGIC DATA BY UPDATING THE MINE PRODUCTION GEODATABASE AND RESULTINGLY THE INTERACTIVE HISTORICAL MINE PRODUCTION WEB MAP CREATED DURING PHASE ONE OF THIS PROJECT. THIS WEB MAP IS HOSTED ON THE CGS WEBSITE. METADATA WILL ALSO BE UPDATED.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: CAPTURING MINE PRODUCTION AND LOCATION INFORMATION BENEFITS THE CGS MINERAL RESOURCES PROGRAM BY CREATING DIGITALLY SEARCHABLE INFORMATION USED FOR MINERAL RESOURCE EVALUATIONS AND RESOURCE ESTIMATION. THE PROJECT DELIVERABLES WILL FACILITATE THE DISSEMINATION OF HISTORICAL MINE INFORMATION TO GEOLOGISTS, THE SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY, AND OTHER MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC WHO ARE INTERESTED IN MINERAL RESOURCES, HISTORICAL MINE PRODUCTION, AND HAZARD MITIGATION OF HISTORICAL MINE SITES. HAVING THESE DATA DIGITIZED ALSO ALLOWS FOR BETTER MAPPING OF CRITICAL MINERAL POTENTIAL AND ENVIRONMENTALLY SENSITIVE SITES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE CONTINUED PRESERVATION AND ACCESSIBILITY OF THESE DATA WILL FURTHER GEOSCIENTIFIC RESEARCH, SUPPORT ECONOMIC GROWTH, AND AID PUBLIC SAFETY CONCERNS. SUCH RESEARCH COULD INCLUDE MINERAL RESOURCE IDENTIFICATION AND GEOLOGIC HAZARD IDENTIFICATION ASSOCIATED WITH HISTORICAL ABANDONED MINE LANDS IN CALIFORNIA. IT IS CRITICAL THAT THIS DATA BE CATALOGED AND PRESERVED FOR CURRENT AND FUTURE USE, AS DEMANDS FOR NATURAL RESOURCES, DEVELOPMENT IN GEOLOGICALLY HAZARDOUS AREAS, AND ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES INCREASE. INDUSTRY, CONSULTANTS, GOVERNMENT AGENCIES (FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL), ACADEMIA, EDUCATORS, STUDENTS, AND THE PUBLIC CURRENTLY USE COLLECTIONS AND DATA HELD BY THE CGS IN A VARIETY OF PROJECTS AND PROGRAMS.

PROJECT TITLE: FY 2023 NATIONAL GEOLOGICAL   GEOPHYSICAL DATA PRESERVATION PROGRAM - FY 23 NGGDPPPERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: 7 1 2023 THROUGH 6 30 2026PLAIN LANGUAGE DESCRIPTION:PRIORITY 1: THE MISSOURI GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (MGS) WILL CREATE ARCHIVE DIGITAL SCANS AND SAMPLE-LEVEL METADATA FOR 800 UNPUBLISHED GEOLOGICAL DATA FILES IN FY23, FY24 AND FY25. MGS ALSO WILL UPDATE NATIONAL DIGITAL CATALOG (NDC) METADATA TO REGISTRY OF SCIENTIFIC COLLECTIONS (RESCICOLL) STANDARDS AND FORMATS.PRIORITY 2: MGS WILL PURCHASE A PETROGRAPHIC SLIDE SCANNER.PRIORITY 3: MGS WILL ENTER 1,000 CORE LOGS INTO A DATABASE DURING FY2023, AND WILL UPLOAD THE DATA TO NATIONAL INDEX OF BOREHOLE INFORMATION (NIBI). LOGS WILL BE SELECTED BASED ON THEIR POTENTIAL TO CONTAIN CRITICAL MINERAL RESOURCE INFORMATION. GEOLOGIC FRAMEWORK DATA GAPS WILL BE CONSIDERED. MGS ALSO WILL SELECT UP TO 200 SAMPLES FOR WHOLE-ROCK GEOCHEMICAL ANALYSES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:PRIORITY 1: GEOLOGICAL DATA FILES WILL BE SELECTED FOR SCANNING BASED ON NATIONAL GEOLOGICAL AND GEOPHYSICAL DATA PRESERVATION PROGRAM (NGGDPP) CRITERIA, INCLUDING MEDIA DEGRADATION AND INFORMATION TYPE. WHEN SCANNING IS COMPLETED, QA QC FOR COMPLETENESS AND CLARITY IS DONE. CREATED METADATA WILL MEET RESCICOLL CRITERIA, INCLUDING KEYWORDS. FOR THE UPDATE OF MGS METADATA IN RESCICOLL, PROJECT METHODOLOGY AND METADATA DEVELOPMENT WILL BEGIN AS RESCICOLL PROTOCOLS ARE RELEASED.PRIORITY 2: NO NGGDPP ACTIVITY BEYOND PURCHASE.PRIORITY 3: CORE LOGS FOR ENTRY WILL BE SELECTED BASED ON THE CRITERIA NOTED ABOVE, AND WILL BE REVIEWED FOR ISSUES. STUDENTS WILL ENTER DATA AND INITIAL COORDINATE COLLECTION. QA QC WILL INVOLVE REVIEW OF ENTERED DATA AND COORDINATES. LOGS WILL BE PUT IN THE NIBI FORMAT FOR DELIVERY. FOR WHOLE ROCK GEOCHEMISTRY, THE SAMPLES WILL BE SELECTED FROM THOSE CURRENTLY IN MGS COLLECTIONS. SELECTION WILL BE BASED ON CRITICAL MINERAL CRITERIA. METADATA WILL BE CREATED.DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:PRIORITY 1: SCANS AND ITEM-LEVEL METADATA WILL BE UPLOADED TO RESCICOLL FOR 800 SCANNED GEOLOGICAL DATA FILES. MGS EXPECTS INCREASED USE OF THE DATA AS OPPOSED TO THAT OF THE ORIGINAL FILES. ORIGINAL FILES WILL BE PRESERVED. THE DATA HAVE MULTIPLE USES, INCLUDING MINERAL DEVELOPMENT  LAND-USE PLANNING  ENERGY  INFRASTRUCTURE AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT  HAZARD MITIGATION  AND ENVIRONMENTAL STUDIES. THE DATA SUPPORT STATEMAP AND EARTH MRI PROJECTS, A MULTI-AGENCY DOE-SUPPORTED PROJECT AND ONGOING HYDROGEOLOGICAL STUDIES. MGS WILL DELIVER UPDATED ORIGINAL NDC METADATA TO RESCICOLL, IMPROVING ACCESSIBILITY.PRIORITY 2: PURCHASE OF SCANNER.PRIORITY 3: MGS WILL DELIVER METADATA FOR 1,000 CORE LOGS, INCLUDING LITHOLOGIC DESCRIPTIONS AND GEOCHEMISTRY, FOR UPLOAD INTO NIBI. ACCESS AND FINDABILITY OF THE DATA WILL BE INCREASED. THE FORMAT MAXIMIZES SEARCH POTENTIAL AND PROVIDES GIS-COMPATIBILITY. AVAILABILITY OF DIGITAL DATA WILL AID PRESERVATION OF THE ORIGINAL PHYSICAL LOGS AND LIMIT UNNEEDED USE OF THE ROCK CORES. FOR WHOLE ROCK GEOCHEMISTRY, MGS WILL CREATE SAMPLE-LEVEL METADATA FOR THE SAMPLES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: PRIORITY 1: GOVERNMENT, ACADEMIC, AND INDUSTRY GEOLOGISTS WHO USE THE DATA FOR MULTIPLE TASKS WILL HAVE GREATER ACCESS TO DATA IN THE FILES, AS WILL OTHER GOVERNMENT AND PLANNING ENTITIES. THE SAME GROUPS WILL HAVE IMPROVED ACCESS TO DATA CURRENTLY IN NDC FORMATS.PRIORITY 3: THE DATA WILL BENEFIT INDUSTRY, GOVERNMENT AND ACADEMIC GEOLOGISTS, ESPECIALLY IN CRITICAL MINERAL WORK  PREVIOUSLY ENTERED DATA HAS SAVED COSTS AND TIME FOR ALL GROUPS. DATA ALSO ARE USED FOR INFRASTRUCTURE AND ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES, AND TO SELECT CORES FOR STUDY FROM THE MGS CORE REPOSITORY. METADATA FOR WHOLE ROCK GEOCHEMICAL SAMPLES WILL ALLOW GREATER ACCESS TO DATA PREVIOUSLY UNAVAILABLE.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES IN THESE PROJECTS.

PROJECT TITLE: ALASKA SAMPLE AND MAP RESCUE, HYPERSPECTRAL SCANNING PROCESS DEVELOPMENT, AND COMPILATION OF MINERAL INDUSTRY RECORDSPERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: 7 1 2023 THROUGH 6 30 2025AWARD PURPOSE:  PRESERVE A VARIETY OF MATERIALS AND DATA OF HIGH VALUE TO ALASKA STAKEHOLDERS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: PROPOSED PRIORITY I DATA PRESERVATION EFFORTS INCLUDE THREE OBJECTIVES: (1) THE RESCUE AND ACCESSION OF RARE AND GEOLOGICALLY SIGNIFICANT SAMPLES COLLECTED BY UNIVERSITY OF ALASKA FAIRBANKS STUDENTS AND FACULTY  (2) THE RESCUE AND PUBLICATION OF A LARGE BODY OF SIGNIFICANT UNPUBLISHED GEOLOGIC MAPPING AND DATA COLLECTED IN SOUTHEAST ALASKA BY GEOLOGIST AND GEOCHRONOLOGIST GEORGE GEHRELS  AND (3) UPDATES TO DGGS  NATIONAL DIGITAL CATALOG METADATA AND COLLECTION RECORDS TO MEET THE NEW REGISTRY OF SCIENTIFIC COLLECTIONS REQUIREMENTS. PROPOSED PRIORITY 2 DATA PRESERVATION EFFORTS RELATED TO DIGITAL OR PHYSICAL INFRASTRUCTURE WILL INVOLVE THE DEVELOPMENT OF A PRODUCTION WORKFLOW FOR THE NEW HYPERSPECTRAL SCANNER TO BE HOUSED AT THE GEOLOGIC MATERIALS CENTER. PROPOSED PRIORITY 3 EFFORTS ARE FOCUSED ON THE PRESERVATION OF CRITICAL-MINERAL-RESOURCES DATA RELATED TO MORE THAN 35 YEARS OF ALASKA MINERAL RESOURCES AND INDUSTRY TRACKING. DATA TO BE PRESERVED INCLUDES COMPANY PRESS RELEASES AND OTHER DOCUMENTS THAT CONTAIN VITAL INFORMATION ABOUT DEPOSIT RESOURCES AND GEOLOGIC INTERPRETATIONS.DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: PRIORITY 1 - ACCESS TO THE UNIVERSITY S SAMPLES, NEW GEOLOGIC MAPPING IN SOUTHEAST ALASKA, AND UPDATED METADATA RECORDS WILL HELP DISCOVERY OF NEW OR ADDITIONAL OIL AND GAS RESERVES, REGIONS OF VIABLE GEOTHERMAL ENERGY, OR NEW ECONOMIC MINERAL DEPOSITS, AS WELL AS LEAD TO INCREASED UNDERSTANDING AND MITIGATION OF GEOLOGIC AND ENVIRONMENTAL HAZARDS IN ALASKA THAT AFFECT THE HEALTH AND WELLBEING OF THE STATE S INFRASTRUCTURE, ECONOMY, AND CITIZENS. PRIORITY 2 - THE CURRENT PHASE OF HYPERSPECTRAL SCANNER PROJECT DEVELOPMENT IS PLANNED TO OPTIMIZE THE ENTIRE CORE SCANNING PROCESS, FROM CORE HANDLING TO DATA MANAGEMENT AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION OF ELEMENTAL AND MINERAL INFORMATION ON THE BOREHOLE CORES HELD AT THE FACILITY. THE NEW DATA STREAM WILL ENCOURAGE INDUSTRY INVESTMENT IN ALASKA S OIL   GAS AND MINERAL RESOURCES. PRIORITY 3 - PUBLICLY AVAILABLE AND EASILY ACCESSIBLE MINERAL INDUSTRY AND RESOURCE INFORMATION WILL ENCOURAGE THE DEVELOPMENT OF ALASKA S CRITICAL-MINERAL RESOURCES AND OTHER POTENTIAL COMMODITIES.INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES): DATA AND SAMPLES FROM DGGS COLLECTIONS ARE EXAMINED FREQUENTLY BY PRIVATE EXPLORATION AND ENGINEERING COMPANIES, UNIVERSITIES, AND STATE AND FEDERAL AGENCIES AS A CRITICAL STEP IN RESEARCH, RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT, AND LAND MANAGEMENT, BECAUSE MODERN SOPHISTICATED ANALYSIS OF ARCHIVED SAMPLES AND DATA IS WIDELY RECOGNIZED AS A COST EFFECTIVE ALTERNATIVE TO THE TREMENDOUS EXPENSE OF CORE DRILLING, SAMPLING, AND DATA COLLECTION IN OFTEN REMOTE AREAS OF ALASKA.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N A

PROJECT TITLE: GSA FY 2023 FOSSIL PRESERVATION AND MAP DIGITIZATION PROJECTPERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: 7 1 2023 THROUGH 6 30 2024PRIORITY 1  PRESERVE GEOSCIENCE DATA AND MATERIALS  FOR FISCAL YEAR 2023, THE GEOLOGICAL SURVEY OF ALABAMA (GSA) WILL CURATE AND CONSERVE 1,600 FOSSIL SPECIMENS THAT ARE CURRENTLY STORED IN SUBSTANDARD CONDITIONS. THE SPECIMENS WILL BE IMPROVED BY PRINTING NEW ARCHIVAL-GRADE PAPER LABELS TO REPLACE ILLEGIBLE AND DETERIORATING HAND-WRITTEN LABELS FROM THE LATE 19TH AND EARLY 20TH CENTURIES, INSTALLING ARCHIVAL FOAM PADDING IN THE SPECIMEN TRAYS TO REDUCE DAMAGE FROM IMPACTS, AND WRITING CATALOG NUMBERS ON THE FOSSILS TO IMPROVE COLLECTIONSORGANIZATION. THESE 1,600 SPECIMENS WILL ALSO BE PHOTOGRAPHED IN AN ARCHIVAL DIGITAL FORMAT TO PROVIDE THE PUBLIC WITH INTERNET-ACCESSIBLE IMAGES OF THESE FOSSILS. UPDATED DATA FOR THE ENTIRE FOSSIL COLLECTION AS WELL AS INTERNET ADDRESSES OF THE SPECIMEN PHOTOS WILL BE UPLOADED IN A MICROSOFT EXCEL FILE TO THE REGISTRY OF SCIENTIFIC COLLECTIONS (RESCICOLL) WEBSITE USING THE UNITED STATES GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (USGS) TEMPLATE. THE DATA AND IMAGES WILL ALSO BE PUBLICLY ACCESSIBLE ON THE GSA WEBSITE. THE SECOND PORTION OF THIS PROJECT INVOLVES MOVING FOSSIL SPECIMENS FROM AN OLD STORAGE AREA IN A SECONDARY GSA BUILDING TO THE PALEONTOLOGY COLLECTIONS FACILITY IN THE MAIN GSA BUILDING. THE GSA IS REQUESTING FUNDING TO PURCHASE THREE NEW STORAGE CABINETS WITH 30 DRAWERS, AS WELL AS 800 NEW FOSSIL SPECIMEN TRAYS, TO HELP STORE THE RELOCATED FOSSILS.PRIORITY 3  CRITICAL MINERALS DATA PRESERVATION  THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DIGITIZE, ANALYZE, AND WRITE STANDARDIZED METADATA USING A MAP SCANNER AND ARCGIS SOFTWARE FOR FIVE HISTORIC GEOLOGIC MAPS AND ONE COUNTY MINERAL RESOURCE MAP THAT COVER PARTS OF SIX KNOWN USGS EARTH MAPPING RESOURCES INITIATIVE (EMRI) CRITICAL MINERAL FOCUS AREAS IN THE ALABAMA PIEDMONT. THESE PAPER MAPS DO NOT CURRENTLY HAVE ANY DIGITAL ONLINE ACCESS AND THEREFORE HAVE LIMITED AVAILABILITY TO THE PUBLIC. IN ADDITION TO THE MAP DIGITIZATION PROJECT, THE GSA WILLDEVELOP A COMPREHENSIVE PRESERVATION PLAN FOR ALL HISTORIC GSA CRITICAL MINERALS-RELATED DATA AND MATERIALS. UPON COMPLETION, THE NEWLY CREATED GEOSPATIAL DATA AND ASSOCIATED METADATA WILL RESPECTIVELY BE UPLOADED TO THE USGS NATIONAL GEOLOGIC MAP DATABASE AND THE RESCICOLL WEBSITE WHERE THEY WILL BE PUBLICLY ACCESSIBLE.A FINAL TECHNICAL REPORT WILL BE PROVIDED TO THE USGS THAT WILL DOCUMENT AND SUMMARIZE THE RESULTS OF THIS PROJECT. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE IMPROVED GSA PALEONTOLOGY COLLECTIONS AND MAP DIGITIZATION EFFORTS INCLUDE COMMERCIAL AND ACADEMIC GEOSCIENTISTS WHO CAN USE THE INFORMATION FOR GEOLOGIC MAPPING AND STRATIGRAPHIC PURPOSES INCLUDING CRITICAL MINERAL AND ENERGY PRODUCTION, INVESTIGATING GROUNDWATER RESOURCES, RESEARCH INTO PAST CLIMATE CHANGE AND HOW IT COMPARES TO CURRENT CLIMATE CHANGE, AND OTHER PALEOENVIRONMENTAL STUDIES. NUMEROUS PROFESSIONAL GEOSCIENTISTS, COLLEGE PROFESSORS AND STUDENTS HAVE UTILIZED THE GSA COLLECTIONS IN RECENT YEARS FOR THEIR RESEARCH PROJECTS COVERING A VARIETY OF TOPICS. ADDITIONALLY, ENERGY COMPANIES MAY INCORPORATE THE FOSSIL INFORMATION INTO THE PALEONTOLOGICAL RESOURCES SECTION OF THEIR REQUIRED ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT STATEMENTS WHEN CONSTRUCTING OR MOVING PIPELINES. FINALLY, THE GENERAL PUBLIC MAY FREELY ACCESS THIS GEOLOGIC INFORMATION IN ORDER TO PURSUE THEIR PERSONAL RECREATIONAL INTERESTS.

PROJECT TITLE: UPDATING METADATA AND CRITICAL MINERALS ASSESSMENTPERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: 5 1 2023 THROUGH 4 30 2024AWARD PURPOSE - PRIORITY 1: THE UNIVERSITY OF TEXAS AT AUSTIN BUREAU OF ECONOMIC GEOLOGY WILL MODIFY AN EXISTING PYTHON SOFTWARE LIBRARY CREATED TO STREAMLINE THE PROCESS OF GENERATING METADATA FILES FOR THE NOW-LEGACY UNITED STATES GEOLOGICAL SURVEY-S NATIONAL DIGITAL CATALOG, TO SUPPORT SUBMISSION TO THE NEXT GENERATION OF THE CATALOG.ALL CONTENTS OF THE BUREAU-S CATALOG OF GEOLOGICAL SAMPLES AND GEOPHYSICAL LOGS WILL BE SUBMITTED TO THE CATALOG, ENABLING THE GEOSCIENCE COMMUNITY AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS TO EASILY DISCOVER AND ACCESS THE MATERIAL AND ASSOCIATED METADATA IN THE BUREAU-S COLLECTION.PRIORITY 3: THE UNIVERSITY OF TEXAS AT AUSTIN BUREAU OF ECONOMIC GEOLOGY WILL FOCUS ON PRESERVING TIME-DEPENDENT, IRREPLACEABLE GEOLOGIC DATA OR COLLECTIONS PERTAINING TO CRITICAL MINERALS. PROJECT TITLE: MICHIGAN GEOLOGICAL SURVEY PROJECT TO PRESERVE COLLECTIONS OF THINS SECTION SLIDES, GEOLOGICAL CORES, AND DRILL CUTTINGS  MAKE THEM FREELY ACCESSIBLE AND DISCOVERABLE THROUGH DIGITAL MEANS  CREATE PHYSICAL INFRASTRUCTURE THAT SUPPORTS PRESERVATION OF THESE PHYSICAL SAMPLES  AND PRESERVE GEOCHEMICAL DATA ABOUT CRITICAL MINERALSASSESSMENTS.PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: 6 1 2023 THROUGH 5 31 2026AWARD PURPOSE: THE MICHIGAN GEOLOGICAL SURVEY PROPOSES A THREE-YEAR PROJECT SUPPORTING NATIONAL GEOLOGICAL AND GEOPHYSICAL DATA PRESERVATION PROGRAM FY2023 PRIORITIES OF PRESERVING GEOSCIENCE MATERIALS, MAKING THEM ACCESSIBLE AND DISCOVERABLE THROUGH DIGITAL ARCHIVES, CREATING PHYSICAL INFRASTRUCTURE THAT SUPPORTS PHYSICAL SAMPLE PRESERVATION, AND ACQUIRING AND PRESERVING GEOCHEMICAL DATA ABOUT CRITICAL MINERALS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS PROJECT WILL PRESERVE AND INCREASE ACCESS TO THREE SIGNIFICANT COLLECTIONS: GEOLOGICAL CORES, THIN-SECTION SLIDES, AND DRILL CUTTINGS FROM MICHIGAN S SEDIMENTARY FORMATIONS BY DIGITAL ARCHIVING. ADDITIONAL NEW WAREHOUSE RACKING AND OTHER STORAGE CONFIGURATIONS WILL BE CREATED FOR INCREASING CAPACITY AND EFFICIENCY. GEOCHEMICAL ANALYSIS OF SALT AND POTASH CORES WILL PROVIDE ELEMENTAL DATA FOR FURTHER RESEARCH.DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FOR PRIORITY 1, (1) PRODUCE HIGH-RESOLUTION DIGITAL IMAGES OF 1198 THIN-SECTION SLIDES, SCANNED 4800 DPI AND 48-BIT COLOR, AS PDF IMAGES, (2) CREATE HIGH-RESOLUTION PHOTOGRAPHS OF 9,000 CORE BOXES, BOTH DRY AND WET, AS PNG IMAGES AND (3) UPDATE OUR CUTTINGS INVENTORY IN THE NATIONAL DIGITAL CATALOGUE, AND REBOX ANY IN NEED OF LONG-TERM PRESERVATION. DIGITAL IMAGES WILL BE UPLOADED TO THE UNIVERSITY S SCHOLARWORKS PLATFORM FOR PUBLIC ACCESSIBILITY. FOR PRIORITY 2, WE WILL CREATE PHYSICAL INFRASTRUCTURE TO ARCHIVE MORE GEOLOGICAL CORES. BY (1) RECONFIGURING OUR RACKING SYSTEM TO HOLD LONGER 5  CORE BOXES THAT WE NOW RECEIVE FROM INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS. INSTALLING RACKING BEAMS 8  ABOVE THE FLOOR, WILL ALLOW OUR REACH TRUCK TO REACH UNDER THE BEAMS, REDUCING ITS TURNING RADIUS SO WE CAN STORE THOSE CORES IN CURRENT RACKING CONFIGURATION. WE WILL ALSO (2) PURCHASE A 40  SHIPPING CONTAINER TO STORE LIGHTER MATERIALS, FREEING UP WAREHOUSE RACK SPACE. FOR PRIORITY 3, WE WILL SUBMIT 200 CORE SAMPLES TO THE USGS MAPPING RESOURCES INITIATIVE FOR GEOCHEMICAL ANALYSIS. IN 2013, WE OBTAINED GEOCHEMICAL ANALYTICAL RESULTS FROM 268 EVAPORITE CORES PRIMARILY IN OSCEOLA AND MECOSTA COUNTIES WHERE POTASH, A CRITICAL MINERAL, HAD PREVIOUSLY BEEN MINED. THIS NEW DATA, WE WILL PROVIDE A BROADER RESOURCE ASSESSMENT FOR SEVEN OTHER COUNITES WHERE THE POTASH DEPOSIT OCCURS IN MICHIGAN.INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES): MEMBERS OF INDUSTRY, GOVERNMENT AND THE SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY WILL HAVE ACCESS TO IMAGES, DATA AND ANALYSES TO MORE EFFICIENTLY INVESTIGATE AND MANAGE MICHIGAN S NATURAL RESOURCES.GEOCHEMICAL ANALYSES OF POTASH WILL BE HELPFUL TO FARMERS, WHO NOW IMPORT MORE THAN 95  OF POTASH FROM OTHER COUNTRIES. PROVIDING MORE DATA ABOUT THIS MICHIGAN POTASH DEPOSIT MAY LEAD TO DOMESTIC DEVELOPMENT OF THIS IRREPLACEABLE RESOURCE THAT IS ESSENTIAL TO FOOD PRODUCTION.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS FOR THIS PROJECT.

PROJECT TITLE: PRESERVATION AND ACCESSIBILITY OF WVGES PHYSICAL SAMPLES AND GEOLOGICAL DATA AND ANALYSIS OF CRITICAL MINERAL SAMPLESPERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: 5 9 2023 THROUGH 5 8 2025PLAIN LANGUAGE DESCRIPTION AWARD PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THE ACTIVITIES PROPOSED UNDER ALL THREE PRIORITIES IS TO MAKE PHYSICAL SAMPLES, DOCUMENTS, AND ANALYSES HELD BY THE WEST VIRGINIA GEOLOGICAL AND  ECONOMIC SURVEY (WVGES) MORE AVAILABLE AND ACCESSIBLE TO USERS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: UNDER PRIORITY 1, THREE PROJECTS ARE PROPOSED. THE FIRST PROJECT IS CONTINUING AN EFFORT THAT BEGAN LAST YEAR TO TRANSFER CRUSHED ROCK SAMPLES FROM DETERIORATING BAGS TO PLASTIC CONTAINERS WITH LIDS. THESE SAMPLES REPRESENT A COMPILATION OF DECADES OF DATA CHARACTERIZING THE TRACE ELEMENT CONTENT OF WEST VIRGINIA COALS AND ASSOCIATED CLAY-BASED MATERIALS. AS COAL MINES CLOSE, THE SUBSURFACE LOCATIONS WHERE THE SAMPLES WERE COLLECTED ARE INACCESSIBLE. THE SECOND PROJECT IS THE CONTINUATION OF CORE PHOTOGRAPHY OF CORES IN WEST VIRGINIA THAT WERE SAMPLED FOR AN EARTH MRI CRITICAL MINERALS UNDERCLAYS PROJECT. THE FINAL PROJECT IN PRIORITY 1 WILL BE THE SCANNING OF A SUBSET OF A COLLECTION OF OVER 40,000 APERTURE CARDS AT WVGES. THE CARDS INCLUDE MINE MAPS, PROPERTY MAPS, DRILL HOLE LOCATIONS, COAL THICKNESS, COAL ELEVATION, AND OTHER DATA. UNDER PRIORITY 2 WVGES HAS PROPOSED TWO PROJECTS. THE FIRST IS TO BUILD AN INVENTORY, CATALOG, AND WEB SERVICE FOR PHYSICAL GEOLOGICAL SAMPLES. THESE DATA INCLUDE IN-HOUSE, DONATED, AND SUBMITTED DATA AND REFLECT COLLECTIONS FROM LEGACY TO MODEM AND INCLUDE A VARIETY OF DATA TYPES THAT WOULD COST MILLIONS OF DOLLARS TO REPLICATE. THE SECOND PROJECT IS THE MODERNIZATION OF A COAL CHEMISTRY DATABASE. THIS PROJECT BEGAN LAST YEAR WITH THE INCLUSION OF MAJOR AND TRACE ELEMENT DATA. IN THIS PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE WVGES INTENDS TO INCLUDE ADDITIONAL DATA AND ANALYSES (PROXIMATE ANALYSIS AND ULTIMATE ANALYSIS. FINALLY, WVGES WILL SUBMIT 200 SAMPLES TO THE USGS FOR GEOCHEMICAL ANALYSES TO BE USED IN THE CHARACTERIZATION OF CRITICAL MINERAL RESOURCES.DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE TRANSFER OF CRUSHED ROCK SAMPLES WILL PROVIDE A MORE PROPERLY STORED AND ORGANIZED COLLECTION OF SAMPLES FOR CURRENT AND FUTURE CRITICAL MINERALS RESEARCH. CORE PHOTOGRAPHS WILL BE PUBLICLY AVAILABLE ON THE WVGES WEBSITE. A WEB-BASED MAP OF THE SCANNED APERTURE CARDS WILL BE CREATED WHERE USERS CAN ACCESS THOSE IMAGES. THE INVENTORY OF PHYSICAL SAMPLES AND ASSOCIATED DATA WILL BE MADE PUBLICLY AVAILABLE VIA A WEB-SERVICE WHICH CAN BE LINKED TO THE NATIONAL INDEX OF BOREHOLE INFORMATION (NIBI). A SEARCHABLE WEB-BASED INTERFACE FOR THE COAL CHEMISTRY DATABASE WILL BE CREATED. ALL GEOCHEMICAL DATA PROCESSED BY USGS UNDER PRIORITY 3 WILL BE PUBLICLY AVAILABLE. ALL PROJECTS WILL HAVE REQUIRED METADATA SUBMITTED TO RESCICOLL.INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES): THE WEST VIRGINIA GEOLOGICAL AND  ECONOMIC SURVEY STRIVES TO MAKE LEGACY AND MODEM DATA ACCESSIBLE NOT ONLY TO OUR OWN RESEARCHERS BUT ALSO TO ANY ENTITY THAT CAN UTILIZE THESE MATERIALS AND DATA TO FURTHER THE GEOLOGICAL KNOWLEDGE OF THE STATE, REGION, AND COUNTRY.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES ASSOCIATED WITH ANY PROJECTS.

PROJECT TITLE  PRESERVATION OF NEW HAMPSHIRE SAMPLE RESOURCESPERIOD OF PERFORMANCE  4 1 2023 THROUGH 3 31 2024PLAIN LANGUAGE DESCRIPTION AWARD PURPOSE  THE NEW HAMPSHIRE GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (NHGS), A UNIT WITHIN THE NEW HAMPSHIRE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES (NHDES) WILL PERMANENTLY PRESERVE AND ARCHIVE ABOUT 170 CUBIC FEET OF THE REDSTONE CORE FROM THE REDSTONE QUARRY IN CONWAY, WHICH IS THE DEEPEST KNOWN CORE IN NEW HAMPSHIRE. THE CORE FROM THIS QUARRY WAS EXTRACTED FROM CONWAY GRANITE IN A GEOTHERMAL ASSESSMENT PROJECT UNDERTAKEN IN 1975. THE DEPTH INFORMATION FOR THE CORE IS AT MAJOR RISK OF BEING LOST, AND THE CORE ITSELF IS AT RISK OF DISPOSAL IF LEFT OUTDOORS IN ITS CURRENT LOCATION. THIS PROJECT INVOLVES REPACKAGING AND TRANSPORT OF THE CORE TO A PERMANENT CORE STORAGE FACILITY AT COLUMBIA UNIVERSITY. APPROXIMATELY HALF OF THE REDSTONE CORE CURRENTLY REMAINS STORED IN WOODEN CORE BOXES ON PRIVATE PROPERTY, NECESSITATING THEIR TRANSPORT TO ENSURE PERMANENT PRESERVATION.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED  NHGS WILL REPACKAGE THE CORES INTO NEWLY PURCHASED CORE BOXES AT THEIR EXISTING LOCATION, EACH LABELED WITH THE CORRECT DEPTH, WHICH WILL THEN BE PLACED ONTO PALETTES. THE CORES WILL BE PHOTOGRAPHED IN BOTH THEIR CURRENT OLD BOXES, AND ONCE PLACED IN THE NEW BOXES. EACH NEW BOX WILL BE NUMBERED, WITH THE CORE DESCRIPTIONS AND CONDITIONS, AND THEIR BOX NUMBERS PLACED INTO A SPREADSHEET. PHOTOGRAPHS OF THE BOXES IN THEIR STORAGE FACILITY AT COLUMBIA UNIVERSITY WILL BE COLLECTED.DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES  ALL COLLECTED PHOTOGRAPHS, BOTH UPON LOADING, AND DISEMBARKING OF THE CORES, AND THE ELECTRONIC LOG CREATED ONSITE IN NEW HAMPSHIRE UPON LOADING WILL SERVE AS THE METADATA RECORDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE CORE AND WILL BE SUBMITTED TO THE NGGDPP PROGRAM, VIA RESCICOLL, UPON COMPLETION OF THE PROJECT.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDED THE SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY, RESEARCHERS, AND THE CITIZENS OF NEW HAMPSHIRE.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES  THE NEW HAMPSHIRE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (NHDOT) WILL BE A SUBRECIPIENT THROUGH AN INTERAGENCY FUNDS TRANSFER. NHDOT WILL LOAD THE REPACKAGED CORES AND PALETTES ONTO AN NHDOT TRUCK. NHDOT WILL THEN TRANSPORT THE CORES TO COLUMBIA UNIVERSITY IN NEW YORK FOR DELIVERY.NHDOT WILL ALSO PROVIDE A FORKLIFT TO LOAD THE PALETTES ONTO THE TRANSPORT TRUCK.

PROJECT TITLE  PRIORITY 1  PRESERVE AND RESCUE GEOLOGIC DATA, UPDATE DIGITAL SYSTEM, CONVERT MAPS TO GEMS FORMAT AND UPDATE METATDATA IN RESCICOL. PRIORITY 2  UPDATE DIGITAL SYSTEM TO IMPROVE ACCESS AND DELIVERY OF GEOLOGIC DATAPRIORITY 3  PRESERVE SAMPLES FOR GEOCHEMICAL ANALYSES  UPDATE THE GEOCHEMICAL DATABASEAND CRITICAL MINERALS WEBSITEPERIOD OF PERFORMANCE  4 1 2023 THROUGH 7 31 2025VIRGINIA ENERGY S GEOLOGY AND MINERAL RESOURCES PROGRAM REQUESTS FUNDS TO PHYSICALLY PRESERVE, DIGITIZE, AND CREATE METADATA FOR APPROXIMATELY 10,000 PAPER DOCUMENTS, MAPS, NOTEBOOKS, REPORTS AND IMAGES IN THREE COLLECTIONS  HISTORICAL IMAGES, UNPUBLISHED GEOLOGIC MAPS, AND FIELD NOTEBOOKS. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE SCANNING OF SLIDES, PHOTOS, DOCUMENTS, MAPS AND NOTEBOOKS, AS WELL AS QUALITY CONTROL AND CREATING HYPERLINKS FOR ALL ITEMS. WE PLAN TO CONVERT TWO (2) COUNTY MAPS TO LEVEL 3 GEMS FORMAT. IN ADDITION, WE WILL GEO REFERENCE OUR ENTIRE UNPUBLISHED FIELD MAP COLLECTION WITH AN ONLINE MAP INDEX AVAILABLE IN ARCGIS. FINALLY, WE PLAN TO REVISE AND IMPROVE THE METADATA FOR OUR 27 COLLECTIONS THAT PREVIOUSLY SUBMITTED TO RESCICOL, INCLUDING HYPERLINKS FOR DIRECT PUBLIC ACCESS TO ITEMS. THE REQUESTED FUNDS WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR A SCIENTIST AND A GEOLOGIC TECHNICIAN CONTRACTED FROM OUR TEMPORARY STAFFING PROVIDER. ADDING ITEMS TO OUR COLLECTIONS AND PROVIDING MATERIALS AVAILABLE ONLINE WILL GREATLY IMPROVE DISCOVERABILITY BY THE PUBLIC, SCIENTISTS AND HISTORIANS.VIRGINIA ENERGY S GEOLOGY AND MINERAL RESOURCES PROGRAM REQUESTS FUNDS TO UPDATE OUR DIGITAL INFRASTRUCTURE. OUR CURRENT VIRGINIA GEOLOGIC INFORMATION CATALOG IS A SQL DATABASE WITH 14 COLLECTIONS STORED IN DISCRETE TABLES THAT ARE NOT CROSS REFERENCED. THE COLLECTIONS ARE NOT INTERRELATED DISCOVERABILITY IS SERIOUSLY IMPEDED. THE REQUESTED FUNDS WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR HIRING A CONTRACT DATABASE DEVELOPER FROM OUR TEMPORARY STAFFING PROVIDER. WE PLAN TO CREATE A MASTER INDEX ACROSS THE COLLECTIONS SO INFORMATION CAN BE FOUND EASILY. WE ALSO PLAN TO ADD TABLES FOR ALL OF THE COLLECTIONS THAT ARE STORED IN OTHER FORMATS SUCH AS MICROSOFT EXCEL AND ACCESS. IN ADDITION, WE PLAN TO PROVIDE SCRIPTS TO SYNCHRONIZE THE SPATIAL DATA TO ARCGIS GEODATABASES THAT ARE USED BY OUR SCIENTISTS. THESE SCRIPTS CAN ALSO BE APPLIED ON OUR WEB MAPS AND ARCGIS ONLINE SERVICE. IMPROVEMENTS TO THE DIGITAL INFRASTRUCTURE WILL GREATLY ENHANCES DISCOVERABILITY AND ACCESSIBILITY OF OUR DATA FOR THE PUBLIC.VIRGINIA ENERGY S GEOLOGY AND MINERAL RESOURCES PROGRAM REQUESTS FUNDS TO PRESERVE INFORMATION THAT IS USEFUL FOR CHARACTERIZING AND IDENTIFYING CRITICAL MINERALS RESOURCES IN VIRGINIA. WE PROPOSE TO SUBMIT 200 SAMPLES TO THE USGS FOR GEOCHEMICAL ANALYSES TO DETERMINE MAJOR, MINOR, AND TRACE ELEMENT COMPOSITIONS, INCLUDING 170 PRESERVED SAMPLES FROM THE ROCK REPOSITORY COLLECTION AND 30 SAMPLES FROM THE DRILL CORE AND WELL CUTTING REPOSITORY COLLECTIONS. THE GEOCHEMICAL CHARACTERIZATION OF THESE SAMPLES WILL HELP OUR SCIENTISTS EVALUATE CRITICAL MINERAL POTENTIAL IN VIRGINIA AND SUPPLEMENT OUR EXISTING GEOCHEMICAL DATASETS. OUR SECOND ACTIVITY WILL UPDATE THE GEOCHEMICAL DATABASE AFTER RECEIVING THE LABORATORY RESULTS AND CRITICAL MINERALS WEBPAGES TO MATCH THE NEW CRITICAL MINERALS LIST FINALIZED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF INTERIOR IN 2022 (FEDERAL REGISTER 87 FR 10381). UPDATING OUR WEB BASED CRITICAL MINERALS INFORMATION WILL PROVIDE SIGNIFICANT VALUE TO VIRGINIA ENERGY S CUSTOMERS, THE MINERALS INDUSTRY, AND SCIENTIFIC RESEARCHERS.

PROJECT TITLE  2023 NJGWS GEOSCIENTIFIC DATA PRESERVATION PROJECTPERIOD OF PERFORMANCE  4 1 2023 THROUGH 3 31 2024THE NEW JERSEY GEOLOGIC AND WATER SURVEY (NJGWS) IS PLANNING THE PROCESS OF CREATING A CENTRALIZED DATA MANAGEMENT SYSTEM. THE PURPOSE OF THE GRANT AWARD IS A DESIGN PLAN FOR A GEOSCIENTIFIC INFORMATION DATA MANAGEMENT SYSTEM. THE NJGWS WILL DEVELOP A DESIGN DOCUMENT FOR A DIGITAL DATA MANAGEMENT SYSTEM, WEB PORTAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE PORTAL TO HOUSE AND DISSEMINATE NUMEROUS TYPES OF SURVEY GEOSCIENTIFIC INFORMATION. MUCH OF WHICH WAS PRESERVED WITH DATA PRESERVATION GRANTS OVER THE LAST 15 YEARS. THE SURVEY WILL MAKE THE DATA AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.THE DELIVERABLE FOR THIS PROJECT IS A DATABASE DESIGN PLAN. PART OF THE DESIGN PLAN WILL INCLUDE TAKING INVENTORY OF ALL THE TYPES OF DATA THE NJGWS CURRENTLY HOLDS. THIS DATA INCLUDES BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO GEOLOGICAL DATA SUCH AS ROCK AND MINERAL SAMPLES, THIN SECTIONS, FOSSILS, SEDIMENT SAMPLES AND CUTTINGS, GEOCHEMICAL ANALYSES, VIBRACORES, ROCK CORES, PETROGRAPHY. GEOPHYSICAL DATA INCLUDING WELL LOGS, ONSHORE OFFSHORE SEISMIC DATA, RESISTIVITY, GROUND PENETRATING RADAR, ELECTROMAGNETISM, MAGNETISM, BOREHOLE LOGS. WATER QUALITY DATA INCLUDING NATURALLY OCCURRING AND ANTHROPOGENIC COMPOUNDS. WATER SUPPLY INCLUDING GROUNDWATER AND SURFACE WATER. HISTORICAL DATA INCLUDING, FIELD NOTEBOOKS, FIELD MAPS, GEOLOGIC MAPS, PERMANENT NOTES, ABANDONED MINE INFORMATION, AND PHOTOGRAPHIC RECORDS.THE DATA MANAGEMENT SYSTEM STRUCTURE WILL BE DESIGNED TO HANDLE ALL GEOSCIENTIFIC DATA THE NJGWS COLLECTS, SCANS, AND DIGITIZES. DATA SCIENTISTS AND OTHER SCIENCE PROFESSIONALS WITHIN THE NJDEP WILL COLLABORATE AND DESIGN A PROJECT PLAN PROPOSAL WHICH WILL BE USED TO DEVELOP THE SOFTWARE NEEDED TO CREATE, STORE AND DISSEMINATE GEOSCIENTIFIC RELATED DATA TO THE PUBLIC. THE ADMINISTRATION PORTAL WILL ENABLE ADMINISTRATORS OF THE SYSTEM, VIA WEB FORMS, TO MANAGE DAILY TASKS, ACTIVITIES, AND SETTINGS WITHIN THE GEOLOGIC SYSTEM S RELATIONAL DATABASE. THIS DESIGN PLAN IS THE FIRST STEP TO CREATE THE DIGITAL INFRASTRUCTURE TO STORE AND SHARE OUR GEOSCIENTIFIC INFORMATION TO THE PUBLIC. EVENTUALLY, WHEN THE DESIGN PLAN IS IMPLEMENTED IT WILL PROVIDE THE SCIENTISTS AND GENERAL PUBLIC THE ABILITY TO MORE READILY ACCESS THE TOPOGRAPHIC, GEOLOGIC, GEOPHYSICAL AND GROUNDWATER INFORMATION COLLECTED BY THE NJGWS SINCE 1835.BY CREATING A DATA MANAGEMENT SYSTEM DESIGN PLAN, THE SURVEY WOULD REALIZE ITS LONG TERM GOAL OF RELEASING MUCH OF OUR DIGITAL INFORMATION TO THE PUBLIC. THIS DESIGN PLAN WILL BE FOLLOWED THE SECOND PHASE OF THE PROJECT WHICH IS TO DEVELOP THE SOFTWARE. WHEN THE SECOND PHASE OF THIS PROJECT IS COMPLETED, THE SURVEY S, GEOSCIENTIFIC INFORMATION WOULD BE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC. THE SURVEY S VALUABLE DIGITIZED GEOSCIENTIFIC INFORMATION WILL BE GREATLY USED BY THE SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY. MANY GOVERNMENT AGENCIES, PRIVATE SECTOR CONSULTANTS, INDUSTRY, ENVIRONMENTAL GROUPS, AND THE PUBLIC COULD BENEFIT FROM THIS SCANNED AND DIGITIZED DATA BEING AVAILABLE FOR RESEARCH, EDUCATION, LAND MANAGEMENT, HAZARD MITIGATION AND ENGINEERING STUDIES.

PROJECT TITLE:NATIONAL GEOLOGICAL AND GEOPHYSICAL DATA PRESERVATION PROGRAM: PRIORITIES 1 AND 2PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: 8/1/2022 THROUGH 7/31/2023PROJECTS FOR BOTH PRIORITY 1 & 2 ADDRESS GEOLOGICAL SAMPLE PRESERVATION, INVENTORY, AND DATABASE  DEVELOPMENT.  PRIORITY 1 WILL BE THE SECOND PHASE OF THE "DAM AND INFRASTRUCTURE STUDY CORE PRESERVATION PROJECT", WHICH WAS AWARDED FUNDING BY THE NATIONAL GEOLOGICAL AND GEOPHYSICAL DATA  PRESERVATION PROGRAM IN 2021. THIS CORE HAS BEEN STORED FOR THE PAST 50-60 YEARS IN FOUR FOOT,  MOSTLY NOT COVERED, WOODEN BOXES AND EXPOSED TO RODENTS, BIRDS, AND OTHER SMALL MAMMALS. THE  FACILITY IS NOT CLIMATE CONTROLLED WHICH HAS CAUSED THE CORES TO BE SUBJECTED TO DRASTIC VARIATIONS  IN TEMPERATURE AND HUMIDITY. THE WOODEN BOXES ARE ROTTING, BROKEN AND CURRENTLY STACKED ON THE  FLOOR. CORE PRESERVATION WILL INCLUDE PHOTOGRAPHING ORIGINAL BOXES, USING HEPA VACUUMS TO  CLEAN GEOLOGICAL SAMPLES, SALVAGING MATERIAL NOT CONTAMINATED BY DROPPINGS, REPACKAGING IN NEW  CARDBOARD BOXES AND/OR BAGS, LABELING NEW BOXES, INVENTORYING, AND COMPILING A DATABASE OF  ~600 BOXES. THE DATABASE WILL BE AVAILABLE ONLINE AND GEOLOGICAL SAMPLES WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR  INSPECTION BY THE PUBLIC. THIS DATABASE WILL BE THE FIRST TIME EVER THAT THE CORE WILL BE MADE  KNOWN TO THE PUBLIC AND SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY. THE POTENTIAL SOCIETAL BENEFITS ARE UNLIMITED  SINCE NO ONE HAS STUDIED THESE GEOLOGICAL SAMPLES SINCE THEY WERE FIRST DRILLED.  PRIORITY 2 INVOLVES GEOLOGICAL SAMPLES FROM THE ELK CREEK ANOMALY IN SOUTHEAST NEBRASKA. THE  SITE IS THE LARGEST KNOWN NIOBIUM DEPOSIT IN THE UNITED STATES. SAMPLES WERE ORIGINALLY DRILLED  AND CURATED BY THE CONSERVATION AND SURVEY DIVISION IN THE LATE 1970S-80S. DOCUMENTS THAT  CORRESPOND TO THESE SAMPLES ARE CURRENTLY BEING SCANNED AND ORGANIZED IN A DATABASE, WHICH WAS  MADE POSSIBLE BY A 2021 AWARD FROM THE NATIONAL GEOLOGICAL AND GEOPHYSICAL DATA PRESERVATION  PROGRAM. THE COLLECTION CONSISTS OF CORE, PULVERIZED, COURSE-CRUSH, AND COMPOSITE SAMPLES.  PRIORITY 2 WOULD ADDRESS ONLY HALF OF THE COLLECTION WHICH CONSISTS OF EIGHT ROWS APPROXIMATELY  35 FEET LONG AND STACKED OVER 15 FEET HIGH AND WHICH OCCUPY APPROXIMATELY 3000 SQUARE FEET.  BOXES ARE MOSTLY ORGANIZED ON UNSTEADY, WOODEN SHELVES THAT HAVE BEEN BOLTED TO THE ROOF  TRUSSES TO BE STABILIZED. THE GEOLOGICAL SAMPLES ARE STORED AT THE SAME FACILITY AS THOSE IN PRIORITY  1 AND ARE SUBJECTED TO THE SAME CONDITIONS. SOME BOXES NEED REPLACEMENT, MANY LABELS HAVE  DETACHED, AND NEARLY EVERY ORIGINAL PLASTIC BAG HAS SOME LEVEL OF DECOMPOSITION AFTER ~30-40  YEARS OF BEING STORED IN THAT ENVIRONMENT. PRESERVATION EFFORTS INCLUDE: 1) PHOTOGRAPH EACH SHELF  AND ENTER METADATA IN AN EXCEL SPREADSHEET, UPLOAD TO DATABASE; 2) ASSESS CONTENTS OF BOX FOR LEVELS OF  PRESERVATION AND REPACKAGE ACCORDINGLY; 3) IDENTIFY, RETRIEVE AND RELABEL GEOLOGICAL SAMPLE BOXES: 4)  MOVE BOXES TO PERMANENT, SECURE PALLET RACKING. THESE SAMPLES HAVE BEEN UTILIZED AS LAB SAMPLES  FREQUENTLY AND EXTENSIVELY OVER THE PAST 40-50 YEARS, AND AS RECENTLY AS FALL 2021. THE  COLLECTION IS PRICELESS TO MINERAL EXPLORATION AND RESEARCH OF RARE EARTH ELEMENTS. THESE SAMPLES  HAVE BEEN UTILIZED AS LAB SAMPLES FREQUENTLY AND EXTENSIVELY OVER THE PAST 40-50 YEARS, AND AS  RECENTLY AS FALL 2021. THE COLLECTION IS PRICELESS TO MINERAL EXPLORATION AND RESEARCH OF RARE  EARTH ELEMENTS. THE COLLECTION IS OPEN FOR INSPECTION BY THE PUBLIC AND ALL GEOLOGICAL SAMPLE  METADATA WILL BE INCLUDED IN THE DATABASE BEING CONSTRUCTED FROM THE 2021 "ELK CREEK DOCUMENT  SCANNING PROJECT", WHICH WAS FUNDED BY THE NATIONAL GEOLOGICAL AND GEOPHYSICAL DATA  PRESERVATION PROGRAM

PROJECT TITLE:PRESERVATION OF WVGES CORE MATERIAL AND CRITICAL MINERALS SAMPLESPERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: 8/1/2022 THROUGH 7/31/2023THE WEST VIRGINIA GEOLOGICAL & ECONOMIC SURVEY WILL UTILIZE FUNDING AWARDED THROUGH THE U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY'S NATIONAL GEOLOGICAL AND GEOPHYSICAL DATA PRESERVATION PROGRAM TO PERFORM WORK UNDER BOTH PRIORITY 1 AND 2 OF THE PROGRAM ANNOUNCEMENT. UNDER PRIORITY 1 A STORAGE FACILITY WILL BE CONSTRUCTED ON THE PROPERTY OF THE SURVEY'S OFFICE SITE. THIS BUILDING WILL BE USED TO HOUSE ROCK CORE, WELL CUTTINGS, AND OTHER GEOLOGICAL SAMPLES. AS OIL, GAS, AND COAL COMPANIES DOWNSIZE THEIR OPERATIONS IN APPALACHIA, ELIMINATION OF SAMPLE STORAGE SPACE IS OFTEN ONE OF THE FIRST COST-SAVING MEASURES ADOPTED. MANY OF THESE COMPANIES HAVE LONGSTANDING RELATIONSHIPS WITH THE STATE GEOLOGICAL SURVEYS IN THE APPALACHIAN BASIN AND FREQUENTLY OFFER TO DONATE SAMPLE MATERIAL RATHER THAN SEE IT DISPOSED OF AND/OR DESTROYED. THE CURRENT STORAGE SPACE IS INADEQUATE TO HOUSE THE VOLUME OF CURRENTLY HELD MATERIAL AND ACCEPT NEWLY DONATED OR REQUESTED MATERIAL. ALSO, THE MAJORITY OF STORAGE IS AT AN OFFSITE FACILITY THAT IS DATED, POORLY CLIMATE-CONTROLLED, AND FILLED TO ABSOLUTE CAPACITY. CONSTRUCTION OF A NEW BUILDING ONSITE WILL ALLOW FOR CURRENT MATERIAL TO BE MOVED TO AN APPROPRIATE TYPE STORAGE SPACE, ORGANIZATION AND PROCESSING OF CURRENTLY HELD MATERIAL, AS WELL AS ACCEPTING INCOMING MATERIAL. BENEFICIARIES OF THIS CONSTRUCTION WILL INCLUDE THE STATE OF WEST VIRGINIA TO BETTER CURATE THE COLLECTION OF GEOLOGICAL SAMPLES AND RESEARCHERS WANTING TO ACCESS THE COLLECTION. THIS INCLUDES GOVERNMENT AGENCIES, ACADEMIA, PRIVATE INDUSTRY, AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC. UNDER PRIORITY 2 OF THE PROGRAM ANNOUNCEMENT THE WEST VIRGINIA GEOLOGICAL & ECONOMIC SURVEY WILL CONTINUE TO AUGMENT THE VOLUME OF AVAILABLE DATA AND INFORMATION TO FURTHER CRITICAL MINERALS RESEARCH. SPECIFICALLY, A PORTION OF THE CURRENTLY HELD CRUSHED COAL SAMPLES THAT HAVE BEEN EXAMINED FOR CRITICAL MINERALS AND ARE IN DETERIORATING STORAGE CONTAINERS WILL BE TRANSFERRED TO NEW CONTAINERS. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR BETTER ORGANIZATION OF THE COLLECTION, BETTER CURATION, AND PROVIDE EASIER RETRIEVAL FOR CURRENT AND FUTURE STUDY. THESE SAMPLES REPRESENT A COMPILATION OF DECADES OF DATA CHARACTERIZING THE TRACE ELEMENT CONTENT OF WEST VIRGINIA COALS AND ASSOCIATED CLAY-BASED MATERIALS. AS COAL MINES CLOSE, THE SUBSURFACE LOCATIONS WHERE THE SAMPLES WERE COLLECTED ARE INACCESSIBLE; MINES ARE EITHER FLOODED POST-CLOSURE, ABANDONED AND PERMANENTLY SEALED, OR ARE DESIGNED TO COLLAPSE AS THE LONGWALL MINING PROCEEDS THROUGH THE SEAM. THEREFORE, THESE MATERIALS FORM A REPRESENTATIVE SAMPLE SET THAT CANNOT BE REPLICATED. ADDITIONALLY, TWO CORES THAT WERE SAMPLED FOR THE EARTH MAPPING RESOURCES INITIATIVE WILL BE PHOTOGRAPHED AND THE PHOTOS WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC. INCREASING ACCESS TO AVAILABLE SAMPLES AND DATA UNDER PRIORITY 2 WILL ALLOW FURTHER RESEARCH BY THE U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY, WEST VIRGINIA GEOLOGICAL & ECONOMIC SURVEY AND OTHER ENTITIES OF THE STATE, SURROUNDING STATES RESEARCHING CRITICAL MINERALS, AND OUR PARTNERS IN ACADEMIA AND PRIVATE INDUSTRY WORKING TO BETTER CHARACTERIZE THE CRITICAL MINERAL RESOURCES OF THE COUNTRY. THE WEST VIRGINIA GEOLOGICAL & ECONOMIC SURVEY STRIVES TO MAKE LEGACY AND MODERN DATA ACCESSIBLE NOT ONLY TO OUR OWN RESEARCHERS BUT ALSO TO ANY ENTITY THAT CAN UTILIZE THESE MATERIALS AND DATA TO FURTHER THE GEOLOGICAL KNOWLEDGE OF THE STATE, REGION, AND COUNTRY.

PROJECT TITLE:PRESERVATION OF GEOLOGIC DATA AND COLLECTIONS IN ILLINOIS: FY22PRESERVATION OF GEOLOGIC DATA AND COLLECTIONS IN ILLINOIS: FY22PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: 8/1/2022 THROUGH 7/31/2023PURPOSE:- PRESERVE GEOSCIENCE DATA AND MATERIALS: RESCUE CHICAGO-AREA ROCK CORES AND MAHOMET AQUIFER SEDIMENT CORES FROM CLIMATICALLY UNSTABLE AND INACCESSIBLE BULK STORAGE, INCLUDING PROPER PROCESSING AND STORAGE, ANALYSIS, AND INCREASED DISCOVERABILITY AND ACCESSIBILITY FOR RESEARCH. PROJECT TITLE:PRESERVING AND DISSEMINATING NEVADA'S GEOTHERMAL AND CRITICAL MINERALS DATAPERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: 8/1/2022 THROUGH 7/31/2023THE PROJECTS FUNDED BY THE 2022 NATIONAL GEOLOGICAL AND GEOPHYSICAL DATA PRESERVATION PROGRAM  WILL SUPPORT THE LONG-TERM STRATEGY OF THE NEVADA BUREAU OF MINES AND GEOLOGY TO PRESERVE AND  DISSEMINATE GEOLOGIC AND GEOPHYSICAL DATA FOR THE STATE OF NEVADA.  PROJECTS INCLUDE CONTINUING A MAJOR EFFORT TO INVENTORY, BARCODE, AND PHOTOGRAPH ALL CORE HOUSED  AT THE GREAT BASIN SCIENCE SAMPLE AND RECORDS LIBRARY (GBSSRL), NBMG'S SAMPLE REPOSITORY. NBMG WILL ALSO RESCUE BLUE MOUNTAIN GEOTHERMAL CORE AND ACCESSION IT INTO THE GBSSRL  COLLECTION. A COMPLEMENTARY EFFORT WILL INVOLVE THE CONTINUED CONVERSION OF GEOTHERMAL WELL LOGS  INTO TABULAR DATA FOR INTEGRATION INTO THE GREAT BASIN CENTER FOR GEOTHERMAL ENERGY'S (GBCGE)  RELATIONAL DATABASE SYSTEM. NBMG WILL ALSO CONTINUE TO DIGITIZE MATERIALS IN THE NEVADA MINING  DISTRICT FILES COLLECTION AND CONDUCT AN INVENTORY OF DONATED MATERIALS. ADDITIONALLY, NBMG WILL CONTINUE THE EFFORT TO COMPILE INFORMATION RELATED TO CRITICAL MINERAL RESOURCES THROUGHOUT NEVADA.  THIS WILL INVOLVE DATA MINING, AGGREGATION, AND INTEGRATION INTO THE CRITICAL MINERALS DATABASE, AS  WELL AS A PILOT PROJECT TO IDENTIFY AND ANALYZE CRITICAL MINERAL CORE. DELIVERABLES FOR THESE PROJECTS INCLUDE 1) A SEARCHABLE ONLINE CORE DATABASE THAT WILL INCLUDE  PHOTOGRAPHS AND RECORDED METADATA, 2) ADDITIONAL PHYSICAL CORE ACCESSIONED INTO THE GBSSRL  COLLECTIONS, 3) TABULAR WELL LOG DATA INTEGRATED INTO THE NBMG DATABASES THAT WILL BE SEARCHABLE  VIA NBMG WEB APPLICATIONS, 4) DIGITAL METADATA AND SCANNED DOCUMENTS SEARCHABLE ONLINE IN THE  NBMG MINING DISTRICT FILES COLLECTION, 5) AN INTERNAL DATABASE OF METADATA FOR ACCESSIONED ITEMS,  AND 6) AGGREGATED METADATA OF CRITICAL MINERALS OCCURRENCES, AVAILABLE VIA NBMG WEB  APPLICATIONS. THE FUNDING PROVIDED BY THE NGGDPP WILL SUPPORT NBMG STAFF SALARIES AND PRESERVATION  EQUIPMENT PURCHASES SUCH AS ARCHIVAL-GRADE BOXES AND FOLDERS.
